Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay St Paddy's weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: Wife and I escaped to Chicago. Planned trip last minute, so closer, affordable hotels were booked. Got a good value. Room was clean, pleasant, enjoyed the shower and soaps. Nice view on the 28th floor. Staff was professional beginning to end, parking was easy. Grabbing taxis was super easy and less than $15 everytime (Shedd, museums under $10). No internet, we used our smartphones-no big deal. We had a few beers and a woodfired margherita pizza in lounge evening we arrived- other travellers were enjoying themselves, vibe was fine and wife liked pizza. Staff down to earth and nice that eve. Enjoyed a quiet dip in pool early one morning, made wife happy. Sunjday morning we left we had breakfast bar- it was nice, not super variety, but nice quality stuff for $19. The staff was really great. Brought us tasty homemade salsas for our omelettes, coffee in press was good, fruit was good. The Hyatt-Regency contributed to our enjoyment of weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Failure on many counts”
Reviews.Author: Don C
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest, this is probably the first and last time I'm writing a review. The Hyatt McCormick Place has moved me enough to do so. They've got a monopoly on the convention center and they know it. Prices are exorbitant and what you get for it is sorely lacking. The rooms are a completely disgrace to any Hyatt. Twice I've stayed here and twice the sheets in a new room showed stains. They were fresh sheets all pressed and tight but there were brown stains on the edges. The bathrooms are quite the joke, a cube like relic from the 90s that can barely fit a toilet let alone a bath. The shower lets out a high pitched whine every time you turn it on and the shower curtains aren't long enough to cover the entire bath and you almost always end up with a wet bathroom floor. The vanity fixtures are dated and barely functional. Even the closet is just a curtain drawn across a small cutout space. The absolute worst part is the noise. The walls are paper thin. You here both adjacent rooms at the same time. It's not just a dull muffle, its full on conversations and even cell phones on vibrate. That is just downright ridiculous. Whenever a door shuts 5 rooms away, you get jolted up in the middle of the night. I'm not a light sleeper but this hotel design is a joke. And by the way, you can pay an upcharge for fridge in your room. Seriously??? Unless you absolutely have no choice or just like to suffer, stay far far away from this dump. Great service staff though. Nice, polite and almost apologetic knowing that you got suckered.

Reviews.Title: “Great for trade shows at the McCormick but......”
Reviews.Author: DMACK15
Reviews.Content: The restaurant at the hotel is just ok but has been understaffed for years now. Not enough waiters which makes the service very slow. The bar is also very expensive and understaffed. The room are nice and clean but the internet is slow. It takes 4 seconds to change the channel on the tv with the remote and it gets annoying fast. If you are an early riser wake up 10 minutes before and turn on the hot water. Gym is nice with good equipment. To get to restaurants in the heart of the city you need to take a cab. During trade shows the cab line starts at 530pm and lasts to 8pm. If you don't have a limo lined up you can wait as long as an hour for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great customer service, Bravo!”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam78
Reviews.Content: We were working the Feb auto show convention and stayed here two weeks. From the warm welcome at front desk, to the management, bell staff, engineer, room service, housekeeping, everything was just wonderful. We stay in hotels a lot because Of the Auto shows, other hotels can learn a lot from the Hyatt! This was an extremely pleasant stay, I have high standards, used to be front office manager in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ADB16
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel -- attractive, spacious, clean, extremely convenient location for McCormick Place. Unfortunately, our room was noisy due to an apparent wind tunnel-effect, which made sleeping difficult. The bellhops and valets were friendly and helpful, and made our return trip to O'Hare very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling decieved”
Reviews.Author: TravelinQueale
Reviews.Content: I got the room via Priceline for a Chicago Bulls game. Apparently I should have seen what was going on in the area. The Hyatt's parking was $30 a night because the 2012 Auto Show was happening! Because of our busy day we only booked one night of the over priced parking and one night down the road. There isn't much dining selections outside the hotel so my boyfriend and I settled for the sports bar place there. The waiter was really nice and talked to us and told us to sign up for Hyatt Gold Passport because if you book two nights, you get one night free. I asked him if it counted if I bought Priceline. He assured me that the program did. They slipped my bill under the door and it had an unknown gratuity charge that I was never charged before at any Hyatt. I went downstairs to the receptionist and explained it to him so the charge was removed. (I left cash on the table) I also signed up for Hyatt Gold Passport. Somehow the nice receptionist decided to charge me another night of $30 parking! I emailed Hyatt about my issues and they responded that buying through Priceline doesn't count and they will email me back about my parking charge. I'm still waiting. It's been over a week! So overall the parking was outrageous! The hotel was clean. The bathroom was outdated. So unless you are working at the McCormick Convention Center. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A few mix ups that were quickly rectified”
Reviews.Author: fallingleaf21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through Priceline with my husband. When I arrived to check in the lady at the desk was very nice. However, she misunderstood my name and actually checked me into an already occupied room. When my husband and I walked in it took me a few seconds to realize the room was already occupied since the occupant was so neat with their clothing and things. We went downstairs where the desk clerk realized that she mistook my last name and put me into a room that was already occupied. She did give us a voucher for the restaurant that was very generous. The room we had was very nice (although the room we originally had seemed to be nicer). It seems like they do many conventions and weddings at the hotel. The on site restaurant was cute. The hotel has easy access to the Metra but poor access to the CTA. The location was not that convenient to touristy things. The hotel itself was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great family access to museum campus”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the hotel with our young children. Because of the cheap rate compared to other family oriented suite type hotels in downtown Chicago, we were able to get two adjoining rooms. Our children enjoyed having their own space, while my wife and I enjoyed the city view at night out of our room. The pool is deep for young kids, as it is a lap pool with no stairs and no depth less than 4 feet, but our kids still enjoyed the pool as an adult was always in the pool with them and there was never anyone trying to swim laps. Both of us adults used the workout room every day and the equipment was in the best shape of any hotel workout area I have seen. It was up to date and well lit with tons of windows. The best part of this hotel is its location in relation to the museum area of Chicago. Our whole family walked the 1 mile to Shedd's Aquarium and the Field Museum twice. The one morning it was a long walk as it below freezing with a strong north wind, but we made it in less than 30 minutes. It's a great walk with a few city blocks, then past Soldier Field, and through the park by the Lake. We also drove to Science and Industry, found free street parking, and that was only about 10 minutes away. Also drove to Greek Town which is within 4 miles. Great experience. Parking at the hotel is $30 to park your own car, which in our experience is reasonable in downtown Chicago. There is no free wifi which is why this hotel gets many low ratings, but is a business oriented hotel next to the convention center, and again isn't different from many business hotels in that practice. The only other negative for families is other than the restaurant/lounge at the hotel, there are no immediately accessible dining options. The closest is a McDonald's a few blocks away, and then after that, it's probably 1 mile to others. Worth mentioning too, in contrast with many of the reviews, is that our experience with the staff, both at the counter and concierge, was incredibly positive. Everyone was very nice, helpful, considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Average big city hotel, with an aggravation”
Reviews.Author: DrSchmincke
Reviews.Content: You can do much better than this hotel for a stay in downtown Chicago. Location: Only for conventions. The only reason to stay here is its proximity to McCormick Place convention center. It would not be suitable for anyone staying in Chicago for tourist reasons, as there are far more nicely situated hotels in "The Loop" for the same price or less. Value: My room was $189, AAA rate. Interestingly, I was told that $220 was the cheapest rate at the hotel by two different staff, yet when I requested AAA rate, both people dropped the rate by $30. They did not ask for my AAA card at check in. Room: Average. Standard chain hotel, with the awkward surprise of the "closet" being built out into the room and closed off by shower curtains. Bathroom small, with below-average amenities. Room size adequate. Long distance view from 29th floor but it was a south side room, facing away from the Loop, so the view was not very interesting. Noisy room: distinct noises from hall and adjoining rooms - slamming doors, running water, flushing toilets, ice dispenser. The room was very clean. Restaurants: Unacceptably poor. This is not in a part of town surrounded by nightlife and restaurants. I would not walk outside alone after dark. You are pretty much stuck here unless you want to drive. At 6:45 tonight when I went down for dinner, the restaurant was closed for a private function. The pizza restaurant was also closed - 1 1/2 hours early. The guest guide said it would close at 8pm, but it had closed at 6:30. Therefore, at 6:45PM there was no open restaurant - just room service or a crowded and boisterous bar (not an appealing choice for a tired, hungry, older female). The hotel should not have closed the pizza restaurant early when the only other restaurant was privately booked. Service: I agree with the earlier reviewer juju030 who said the service is terrible. Exception: Erik at the front desk was terrific at check in. No other staff approached his level of service. The staff in the halls avoided my smile. The concierge desk seemed to think I was out of line for complaining about the lack of any restaurant at suppertime. I was on hold 5+ minutes when I finally called room service, and was told it would take 35 minutes to bring up my salad. The room service staff were unresponsive to my complaint about the lack of a restaurant. Overall: This reviewer travels a great deal, and know that any hotel can deliver uneven results. However the uniformly lackluster aspects of this hotel, its poor location, noisy and odd rooms, and abysmal customer service would all keep me from recommending it to anyone unless they MUST stay at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure with a Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Powerplant66
Reviews.Content: Thomas the front desk manager made it possible for me, my brother, my two sons and their two friends to have an impropmtu overnight adventure. We had left the final day of the Auto Show when Thomas helped to create a wonderful overnight in the very nice Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: Lorissac7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the last weekend of the auto show! Our room was amazing!!!! The views of the city was unbelievable! Our room was perfect! The tv kept going light and dark but that wasn't a big deal! Room was quiet for it being a busy weekend! Only noise complaints were doors slamming in the am! They should put something on the doors to help them slowly shut! But hotel was amazing! We will definelty return!

Reviews.Title: “room is nice - service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: juju030
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights had to queue to check in and had to queue again for check-out I left my luggage at the consierge and the consierge refused to give it back to me unless I gave him a tip in advance ( I had just been queuing 30 minutes to retrieve my suitcase) Room is OK Location of the hotel is good

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelManSouth
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - clean, comfy, reasonably priced restaurant. I was there for a meeting - the meeting staff was great. While not walking distance to places, it's 2-3 miles to great restaurants. I was there for the Auto Show - just everything you could want in a hotel...nice gym too

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice and convenient Hotel & 1 Suggestion.”
Reviews.Author: William P
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice and convenient Hotel, and when you factor in the location, what you see is what you get. Last time I was here, which was some light years ago, had a nice stay. There is 1 suggestion however. I would Like to see some form of an Exciting and Thrilling experience be added to this complex. That being, a Free Fall type of ride up to the highest point of this 330 foot (33) story complex, where 4 passengers in a gondola (see Great Americas Edge), and ascend up an Elevator shaft all the way to the highest belconing. Once the car is ascended to the Hotels Highest point, it sits for just seconds before the car is released and drops 330 feet streight down, at so many mph. Patrons riding this ride, would land on their backs at the end of this ride, with the bottom track being dug underneath the Hotel instead of It being layed out on the street. It be a great adrenalin rush unlike any other in the USA and North America ever experienced anywhere. It would add to the Chicago South loop and would just add soo much to the City and add business in the area. It would unify partons from all over Chicago, and make the surrounding area, be more active and happening. This would be Only seasonal as the harsh Winters and even early spring weather is always unpredictable. It be a Summer & early Fall attraction only. There would be little construction on the Inside, as the 8 Gondolas would take an Elevator shaft through the actual Building. However, the Drop, would be on the outside of the West End of the Hotel complex. I would really consider this a thought and would try this . Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “excellent view”
Reviews.Author: mollyiowa
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year for the Chicago auto show and are never disappointed with our room. Excellent lake and city views. We were upgraded to a suite and had walls of windows lots of room to relax. Beds are very comfortable. Nice pool and gym area. Room service was quick, food hot and tasty. Taxis and Metra easily accessible. Self park easy and in covered lot connected to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay Far Better”
Reviews.Author: PDRoberts
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to the Hyatt at McCormick Place and far better than my 1st a year ago. I was there for a three day conference. It really is in the middle of nowhere for those without cars. I had a cold ten block walk from the Chinatown subway station. Leticia checked me in and was very gracious in providing an upgrade to a corner suite. The room was huge though a bit sparsely decorated. Very expansive views. One bathroom, but a full kitchen. The desk was unusually small. Great couch and armchairs for entertaining. Service throughout my stay was very good from hotel and restaurant staff. The lady who runs Forno is always particularly friendly and always wants to provide a sample while you are waiting for some tasty food. The only miss was that our room service dishes were out stinking up the corridor from 11 pm till almost noon the next day even though I called immediately to have them picked up and in the morning asked a second time. I enjoyed the pool this time getting some laps in. Last year I was there on Saturday and it was absolutely full of children, teens and adults. This year I enjoyed it all by myself. Don't know that I woul stay here if I wasn't at a conference, but all in all a very good stay. Good value for the cost

Reviews.Title: “convenient when displaying at McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: northernRaven
Reviews.Content: Just got done with displaying at an Expo in McCormick Place. Staying at Hyatt Regency McCormick made the logistics so much easier. No parking or grabbing taxis morning and night. No having to go outside unless I wanted to. And especially having a close walking distance from my room to the Expo area! Previous years our company had us staying at other hotels and the logistics of parking or cabs and timing was a real pain. Besides that, the room at the Hyatt was well appointed and generally well kept, with the carpet starting to show some serious wear in our room. The staff was absolutely the best - excellent guest service. On-site parking quite spendy at $30/day if I remember correctly. We will definitely stay here the next time we're displaying at McCormick Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place right next to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Rocknrollchica2
Reviews.Content: This was a very convienent location however be aware there is not much within walking distance. We cabbed to all restaurants... the room I was in was just standard, but some of my coworkers were placed in nice suites. This hotel is right next to Lake Michigan. I would stay here again for the convience of it being connected to the convention center, but other than that probably not. The hotel food is good though, just pricey for ok food. Service was nice too. It was a great experience, just too far out from everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: sdwrdt
Reviews.Content: We'd spent 7 hours trying to travel the 1-1/2 hours to downtown during a 6-10" snowfall. The front desk staff were extremely accommodating with directions, gave us wonderful room (31st floor city-view, despite the fact that we were "bid-your-own" priceline customers). My only complaints were that the music throughout the public areas was so loud it was difficult to take a phone call (barely any reception in our room) and the clock was off and couldn't figure out how to adjust the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiN55
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful time and the bed felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. They have good restaurants in the hotel and their pizza was the best in Chicago. The room was beautiful, my only complaint is that I believe that the WIFI should have been free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelRater2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in skyline suite for two nights for a conference. It was great!! Room service was top notch for breakfast but they came at the last possible minute within the 30 minute period. Stayed in room 2801 with views of downtown Chicago and Lake Michigan. Also, the train station is only a short walk away to get access to downtown Chicago area. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “convention hotel next to convention centre in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: peter c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for convention delegates who are attending convention or meeting in the convention centre next door. There are sky hallways connecting to the convention centres and hence one does not need to go outdoors. The drawbacks are it is away from the downtown core and museums. There is no subway close by but there is a bus stop just in front of the hotel. One can take a bus to the downtown core or a bus to nearby subway station. There is apparently a train that comes close by to hotel but I did not try the train while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for conferences/conventions at McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: ROBnMO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December of 2011 for a convention at McCormick Place. Location couldn't have been better, never had to walk outside to get to the conference. The room was nice, with a nice view of the lake (i was on the 30th floor, not facing the city). Overall, the room was clean, but there were minor things that would have made it better - what appeared to be a coffee stain in the carpet, some mior touchup in the paint in the bathroom. Also, the heating was finicky, although it worked fine overall (blew cool air when it reached temperature instead of shutting off at times). The iron looked hardly used, but could have used replacement. The restaurants on site were pretty good, especially liked Shor. They a resort-priced, but right on target for what I've seen in Chicago price-wise. There is a Metra station right next to the hotel, and the #3 CTA Train runs right in front ot the Hyatt to Michigan Avenue, so although the location isn't necessarily in the heart of downtown, it's very accessible with public transportation. The service at the hotel was very good. Every staff member I had dealings with treated me very well, and made me feel welcome. I absolutely will stay he again when I return next year. On a final note, the bed at this hotel was among the most comforatble I have ever slept in, including my own bed at home. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hot at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt McCormick Place is definitely a convention hotel, which isn't necessarily positive or negative, unless you are staying there for a leisure visit. Location simply isn't the best--a 9 to14 dollar cab ride is required to get you into the loop area for restaurants, theatres, shopping, and a few museums. My stay at the Hyatt was pretty good after changing rooms. The first room had a problem with the temp control. The temp must have been no less than 85 degrees. It took a 2nd engineer to realize that a valve was broken and not quickly fixable. Thankfully, a helpful and kind front desk representative got me moved to another room which worked out quite well. While the engineer and front desk folks were quite nice and helpful, the bellman who helped move my luggage wasn't quite as friendly and definitely waited for his tip. Although I tipped him, the hotel offered to send him up to assist with my move. Not so cool on the bellman's part. The room was clean and everything was in working order. Bed & pillows weren't bad at all. My only warning for those of you who are sensitive to highly perfumed soaps/shampoos/lotions...the Hyatt provides Portico bath products, intensely scented w/a spiced ginger type smell. Because I am challenged with this sort of thing, I brought my own bath products. One great amenity--they provide a travel size tube of Aquafresh toothpaste!

Reviews.Title: “Nice establishment!”
Reviews.Author: Becky N
Reviews.Content: So usually Hyatt is outside my price range, but I managed to get a discounted rate based on when I was travelling. I was in town for only 2 days, but the hotel staff was polite and professional, the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. I really enjoyed my stay. My only qualm is that the hotel isn't located near downtown, or in walking distance to anything. But that is more a function of my choosing a hotel based on amenities rather than location. The hotel is connected to the convention center, so this is nice if you have business there. Otherwise, expect a $8-9 cab ride each time you want to go downtown. There are typically taxis waiting outside the hotel, so transportation is fairly accessible.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST IF YOU NEED TO BE@ McCORMICK CENTER”
Reviews.Author: manhattan10021
Reviews.Content: this hyatt is connected to the McCormick center so if you have a business event ,it's a no brainer to stay there. Service is excellent - professional, personable, helpful, all with a smile. Rooms and restaurant are adequate. Rates when I was there were about half price of comparable down town hotels, so even if you are not in town for a McMormick center event, if on a tight budget, it may pay to stay there and take a short bus ride to Chicago's center. The $30 upgrade was a good deal: daily breakfast for two, free Internet connection, one item pressed daily, free newspaper and water.

Reviews.Title: “No longer Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: NCMort
Reviews.Content: When no big shows are open, this Hyatt is not really a first-class hotel. Smaller meetings or pre/post show setup at McCormick Place mean services like shoe shines and early afternoon bar are not to be found. Also, upgrade services (and how to take advantage of them) were not fully explained. Although the room was clean and staff was friendly, I found the overall value to be poor compared to other options available near center city. The premium price is strictly for proximity to McCormick Place; overall, the room and amenities are not up to what I have come to expect of a Hyatt property.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Bauxman
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stay from a business meeting and I didn't want to hit the road so soon. I checked into a very clean room with a wonderful view. The check in process was flawless with excellent customer service. I slept like a baby" not to mention the Seafood Duo was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to McCormick Place, but well-worn...”
Reviews.Author: NC_Woodman
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt serves well for those meeting at McCormick Place, and the service is very good, but the rooms are in need of redecorating (moderately worn carpeting, defects in wall covering, etc.). Despite their advertising stating how well-filtered the ventilation is for the rooms, this was one of the dustiest hotel rooms I have stayed in. Despite this, I would stay here again because of the location. It was a good place to sleep and bathe, but the rooms are not going to win any rewards for aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Will return!”
Reviews.Author: Nian94
Reviews.Content: Nice stay. Ideal if u r there to attend a meeting at Mc mormick place. Great service and very freindly staff. Stayed at the 28th floor. Fabulous view of Lake Michigan and Chicago city. Room was very clean and nice. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: WhitePineLane
Reviews.Content: My 12-year-old daughter and I stayed here in October for a dance competition (very convenient - held right in the hotel). We were very pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was! Service was excellent - everything from the front desk people, to room service, to the gal who brought us an emergency sewing kit when we needed it! Additionally, with lots of kids staying in the hotel for this competition, there were kids running up and down our hall at 10:30 one night screaming. I called the front desk, and they immediately had security up to our floor and put a stop to it. One tip: We reserved through the hotel website, and they have some kind of standby deal where you can upgrade your room for just $15 if they have empty upgraded rooms when you check in! We did this and it was SO worth it! We got a City View room on the 33rd (top) floor, and the fantastic view of the lake and the Chicago skyline was one of the highlights of our stay! Hotel is very far from shopping/sites, but a bus pass bought at the front desk was all we needed for super-easy transportation! The bus stop is right outside the hotel, and it takes you straight up Michigan Avenue. Perfect, and so much cheaper than cabbing it around town. Beds were comfy, room service great - I might possibly even stay here again even if we didn't have an event in the hotel or the convention center! Two small cons: Very few cable channels - especially for families. (But you could pay to watch kids' favorite shows - $4.99 a show or $9.99 a movie!) The rooms have wifi, but it is fairly slow, and not free.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Convenience”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: Had a meeting at McCormick Place and decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency for convenience. Should've picked one of my old favorites downtown. This hotel is horrible. Mattress was the worst I could remember in quite some time. The rooms were cleaned at all hours - 5pm one day, 7pm the next day and one day, not at all. After a long of day of business meetings you don't want to return to find your room not cleaned. Only two restaurants and a lounge in the facility, but they share much of the same offerings and aren't open at the same time - you often have 1 restaurant choice and the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Fine experience but room could use a deep cleaning”
Reviews.Author: sb631
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Front desk staff could not have been more pleasant. The one flaw was that the room needs a good deep cleaning. There was a considerable amount of dust on wall fixtures. The lights in the bathroom looked like they hadn't been cleaned in months. There was mold under the soap dish in the shower. The room was fine with clean floors and bed, it was just those out of the way places that had been continually neglected. The business plan was great. The restaurant had an excellent breakfast with many healthy choices. The bar / lounge area was comfortable with an equally nice bar menu that also had many healthy choices. This hotel is great for anything at the conference center. It is a distance from the city but bus line 3 passes right in front of the hotel and for a mere $2.25 you can be in the heart of things in under 10 minutes. If you are in to outdoor recreation the hotel has great access to the recreation path along the lake. A short walk/run up to 18th Street and you'll find a bridge that will take you over to the path by Soldier Field.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat dated; not Hyatt's best”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Buckeye
Reviews.Content: Travelled here on business. I frankly expected a little more than I got. Booked a "suite" at more than double the deluxe room rate, with a sitting area. What I got was 2 rooms where they had knocked the wall down, and put a dated, nearly tacky couch and cheap coffee table opposite the bed. I would NEVER invite a client or colleage to meet in the room. Looked great for the 1980's or 1990's. Hyatt could, and should, do better. They need to reinvest some money in this location...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. great service.great views”
Reviews.Author: philw87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in September as part of a sightseeing holiday. The hotel is in a good location it is not right downtown but you can walk it in about 30 minutes or there is an 'L' train station nearby. The hotel staff here were extremely helpful and friendly. I spoke to Erik at the front desk who was very helpful. Sadly I'd been travelling throughout the night and was exhausted so I couldn't really take in what he was saying. Apologies to you Erik if you read this. He put in room 2915 which has an absolutely breathtaking view. I'd recommend anyone staying at this hotel to request that room because I was amazed every time I saw that view. The room was nice and big and the decor was very nice. There were 2 small gripes I had about the room which were that you had to pay for the wi-fi which is not very competative as I stayed in many hotels from Florida up to Illinois on my trip and this is the only place I was charged. Secondly there was no fridge or microwave in the room which was disapointing as I like to have drinks and snacks in room and not being able to chill them was disapointing although there was an ice machine in the hallway. All in all this is a well run hotel in a good location with excellent staff. I was so impressed with these aspects of the hotel I still want to give it 5* despite the small gripes mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating staff (mostly) but hotel is only convenient to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: SDBGalveston_TXUSA
Reviews.Content: The furniture in our upgraded room reminded me very much of the rental furniture I had in my first apartment, complete with nicks and scrapes. The bathroom door would not shut. The closet consisted of a curtain. Plenty of electrical outlets on the desk though. Our upgrade got us, at floor 16, above the clutter of close by building so we did have a view of the Navy Pier, Soldier Stadium, the lake and downtown. Higher would be better, facing north. The halls are barren with not a plant or piece of decorative furniture in sight. The health club though is very good with a nice heated pool. Unless you plan on eating at the hotel for all of your meals there is precious little within walking distance of the hotel. A ten dollar taxi ride will get you to downtown or $2.25 ride on the Metra E train however the train has a limited schedule at McCormick place with an hour between trains at times. We were discouraged from walking in the evening. The hotel is directly connected to the Convention Center and there is a food court although the hours seem sparse. The hotel restaurant was good, sometimes very good and the service was always very good. The menu is not large but if you are only staying a few days there is enough variety to please most. Given the captive audience the Shor restaurant was suprisingly good. Big city price for a so-so room. Proximty to the Convention Center is the sole draw here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UncleStevie
Reviews.Content: Whlel the hotel is very nice appearing, I found several things wrong which should have been addressed by maintainance and housekeeping. the furnishings wer excellent, the bed fairly comfortable, but the sheets were too short, The top sheep was tucked in such a manner that when the bed was turned to sleep in, the sheets came loose and were wrinkly to sleep on. Not at all comfortable. The bathroom was worse. There was mold on the grout in the bottom of the shower, the wall paper was peeling off and the the door was delaminating and parts torn off. I was too busy with my business to complain to them so I endured several days, but was frustrated with the shortcomings of what should have been a 5 star rating and instead was disappointing. A plus was the view of the city which is beautiful. The in hotel coffee and tea prices were about 50% above normal not in hotel prices at Starbucks. .

Reviews.Title: “A bit remote from the city sights, but happy with hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Digicision
Reviews.Content: First, I was a bit disappointed that the website did not provide instructions from the airports on how to get to the hotel by public transit. It is a convention center hotel, so most people will probably take a taxi or the airport express, but I wanted to save some money as I was not in a rush. So for those of you like mind, I can at least offer instructions from Midway airport. - take orange line directly from midway airport. Buy a fare card for $2.50 (2.25 for train, .25 for transfer to bus) or you can get a day or multiway pass if you think you'll use more transit. Get off at Roosevelt and exit the station. You'll need to find out which direction is East (you'll be facing either north or south depending on which exit you use). Walk two blocks east to Michigan (passing wabash) and catch a number 3 bus heading south. In about 5 minutes, you'll get to McCormick Place stop (yes, the stop is actually named that). Cross the street and there you are 2.50. As for the hotel, the service was extremely friendly (actually everyone is really friendly here... Chicago is becoming one of my favorite cities). I also booked a horseshoe hammond casino rate, and there is a free shuttle bus going there and back daily from the hotel (saving you about 160 bucks). Free airport check in machines in lobby is great too. Food in restaurant was very good, although a bit on the pricier side. Rooms very clean, but I have to be honest, a bit dated. The bathroom needs a makeover if the hotel is to compete with the trendier hotels like W etc. Also, the "closet" is basically a cubby hole covered with a curtain. That I have not seen before at a Hyatt. Also, rooms are not very soundproofed, so if you are planning to make "noise" be forewarned. Also be prepared to take a cab to get to downtown or the city sights, if you don't want to figure out the bus options. All in all though, a pleasant stay for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Holly1875
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference primarily because my husband was a speaker and had early morning presentations. He figured it was better to be closer than to have to rely on a shuttle bus or taxi. Positives: The staff is friendly, professional and helpful. Any thing we asked for was accommodated (for instance I asked for a bathrobe and one was delivered promptly). Room service came when scheduled. As Passport members we got free internet, a view room and a late check out. Negatives: Ridiculously pricey for both room and food. A small bottle of water was $3.00 for goodness sakes! You are captive if you don't have a car; there are no nearby stores and very few decent restaurants. You need to taxi everywhere if you want to leave the McCormick Place area. AND, the taxi line near dinner time one evening was about 30 people deep. The rooms are ok, and a little beat up. And how come there weren't bathrobes in the room when they are in other Hyatts? If you have the option to book a hotel closer to downtown and its conveniences I highly recommend that. It could be less expensive and more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality & Price..location requires taxi to anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Douglas L
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and the cityviews are great ! The price is right ! The location lacks. You will need to take a taxi ride to get about anywhere - you could probably walk to Soldier Field though

Reviews.Title: “OK, Close to Convention Center, South of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jn2jn2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times, the Hotel is located in South Chicago area, at the Convention Center. Staff was friendly. I asked for, and was given a room with a city view, up high. The room I had was handicap-able, so I think it was a bit different the the rest. The elevators were fast and efficient, the property was clean. 2 computers are offered in the lobby to print airline documents. The internet in rooms was slow, but useful. Not certain if I will be charged for it or not? My only Negative is that there are no in room Safes. I called and was told that I could keep my valuables in the safe behind the front desk ?? Odd for a hotel?? Who wants to wait in a lines to access cash, or personal property? The Red Line Subway is about a 5 block walk, safe by day. Check out the Shark~ Chicken & FIsh takeout restaurant close by, Great Catfish !!

Reviews.Title: “typical business Hyatt location, ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: hog4oc
Reviews.Content: Stay there for internet summit - close to convention, service is good but room need a little bit update. Restaurant downstairs are very good.

Reviews.Title: “great convention center, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xplorthwrld
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel but expected better. I had some minor problems with room service (45 min on the phone waiting for someone) but when I complained food came right away and was good. Little things like the bar had no orange juice in the morning. The tray stayed outside my door until 2 PM next day ( I called to have it cleaned). But overall you can have a nice stay and front desk was excellent service. Very nice business center and gym with indoor pool (I did not use both). Location is about 10 min (12$ by taxi) to Michigan Ave. There is nothing around the hotel at walking distance. The McComick place convention center is impressive. Overall to me looked like a good hotel which is targeted toward groups for meetings and not single tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... needs a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an unbeatable location as it the only hotel attached to the McCormick place convention center. However, you need to be aware that otherwise there is little to do or see near the hotel and there are no restaurants near by. The hotel is well kept, but the rooms are a bit dark and could use better sound proofing and better black out shades. Very limited food choices and there is no room service sometimes. Incredible service at check in by Katie!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pleasure in Hyatt Regency McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: HazraFamily
Reviews.Content: My (Sundargopal Hazra) family and my brother-in-law (Sumit Guha) were lucky to have a pleasant and romantic stay in Hyatt Room # 802 & 802 on 16-7-11 to 17-7-11. We went to Chicago as a Tourist and booked the Hotel through internet and my Frequent Flyer Number is provided during booking. We enjoyed loy specially my daughter because the location is perfect, Hospitality is very nice and food is excellent. It's a Dream stay for us. We want to go to Chicago to stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: gregm757
Reviews.Content: The hotel, as a whole, was great. The only 2 things that [I thought] left something to be desired, was the service at the restaurant and use of the business center. As far as the restaurant, most of the wait staff were clueless. Each morning (14 of them), we had to wait and wait and wait. Simple things like juice and ketchup were hard to get. Although my company covered expenses, I thought $15 for eggs, home fries and toast was quite steep. ($20 and up for a bagel and lox.) I am a frequent business traveler, but never seem to get used to the prices in hotel restaurants. I tip quite generously, and one would have thought that the wait staff would remember a good tipper and make sure we were taken care of. (Not that others should be neglected!!) The business center was rediculously over-priced. Make sure you have your laptop and print whatever you need elsewhere!! On a good note, the staff were very accomodating, polite and helpful. The rooms are large, modern and clean. Absolutely no reservations about staying there again, on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Irishcreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Very nice hotel, large rooms, great location. Rooms are clean and quite. Gym is excellent....pool is ok. They also have a small sundeck. Service was excellent...even cleaning staff go out of their way to say hello. On site resturants are average. Parking is a little stiff at $25 a day. Lots of cabs to take you anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Conventions in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: palitigate
Reviews.Content: If you have a convention in Chicago, this is the place to stay, at least for sake of convenience. It's attached to the McCormick Convention Center so if you need to run to your room, it's right there. Also, you don't have to deal with the buses and LONG taxi lines for major conventions. I have several major conventions each year in Chicago and always try and stay there. Nice clean rooms, good service, good restaurants. The only thing missing is an active night life. Since this really is a convention hotel with nothing right next to it, you will have to go elsewhere for anything fun!

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: diablo676767
Reviews.Content: so the only reason i gave it a 3 instead of 1 was their friendly, SUPER FRIENDLY front desk agents. but nice agents won't make up for all the other negatives. Concierge Desk guy was horrible. i was standing there for 20 minutes while he was talking to someone about his car and his dog. i had to go to front desk to get directions somewhere. elevators were too slow. trust me, it may not seem like a big deal now but you will realize it is a big deal when you are waiting 8-10 minutes for an elevator to come down. it's far away from any store or restaurant. we walked, but not everyone can walk 1.3 miles to get to a restaurant. you will have to get a cab to go to just about anything. again you can find other hotels within walking distance of everything. the only snack/convenience store in the hotel was the most expensive ever. $2 for one small banana, $2 for a kitkat. $12 for a horrible cold ham and cheese sandwich. if you have lots of money to blow off on their expensive restaurant and lots of cab fare then this is a great please, if not, go somewhere else. also if you need direction, well, figure it out yourselved because the concierge is too busy talking about his dog.

Reviews.Title: “Overated (star wise). Not near near the loop or Mich. Ave. Nice enough, but not at their price.”
Reviews.Author: JNB412
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and we got a heck of a deal on Priceline negotiator ($80 per night) but there is now way their 4 star rating matched what we saw. Even the 3.5 star rating here is way, way too high. Dust in all the vents, dirty floors (Notice white dust on all dark carpet everywhere) and hairs on the bathroom counter do not happen at 4 star hotels. They just don't happen. Pool deck and locker room were filthy. I guess the upper floors have been remodeled. But fourth floor unit was old and drab. The staff was nice and thats what in my book gets them a two star. Front desk staff was very helpful (Carley).

Reviews.Title: “Amtrack put us there, great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Florian10112
Reviews.Content: Restaurants on first floor. Shor (very nice) closes for breakfast at 11:00 a.m. Best beds ever!!! 26th floor nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located!”
Reviews.Author: neastman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to many of Chicago's attractions, but not many within walking distance. I was there for a conference being held at Navy Pier, and was glad that shuttle service was provided for our group. I was a little disappointed in the size of the rooms, and the lighting in the bathroom left much to be desired. Internet service was expensive and unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent gym!”
Reviews.Author: tstretch
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here & the gym us excellent! It's a HUGE hotel tho with all the convention stuff so be prepared to walk if you're doing a conference there!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Medinatraveler
Reviews.Content: Needed a weekend getaway, got this through priceline at a very good, not great (don't forget Chicago parking) price. Their parking ($30/nt) is actually decent for Chicago, but really adds up. I expect they are booked during week for Conv Center business so good place for weekend discounts. Service was very good. Especially front desk who could answer questions. Requested room with nice view and was not disappointed. Enjoyed nice workout area (riding bikes have TV and headphones right on them). Arrived on Friday afternoon and found it hard to pull into garage with so many people checking out. Room layout is nice with partial walls that give more open feel. Good strong shower. The bus stop right out front and day pass made going into downtown very convienent! The bus takes you right up Michigan Ave! If you like to ride bikes, bring them, as Chicago is very bike friendly with bike lanes and the shoreway trail which is not far from hotel. We did not bring bikes and ended up walking to Planaterium to rent a tandum bike from Bike-n-Roll

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Jesmine S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but nothing comes with room even though we paid a lot. NO free breakfast, no wifi, nothing! The view we had from the 22nd floor was great but the bedding was outdated and the bathroom was small. Wouldve rather paid this much and stayed somewhere else. Probably wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a discount; Not so much at full price.”
Reviews.Author: FoieGravitas
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by stating that I'm basing it on having paid full price for the room. That being said, I did not pay full price. I've stayed in luxury hotels all over the world, and let me state that this is not a 4 star hotel. It is a 3 at best. The rooms are dated, the walls are scuffed, and the carpet is shabby. The bed linens are decent; the mattresses need to be replaced. The bathroom vanity was stained and chipped, as were the wicker baskets used to hold the toiletries. The air vents in the room had dust buildup several centimeters thick. The staff is friendly and helpful, although the concierge needs to stay current with the museum schedules and offers. The Art Institute has not been free on Thursdays since May. The location is out of downtown, so transportation is needed to get anywhere on the Loop. Luckily there was always a queue of taxis waiting for a fare and the #3 bus stops right outside the hotel. The area is nice enough, although I wouldn't go walking after dark. All and all for the "discount website's" price this hotel is a good deal presuming you don't spend all of your savings on transportation. I would stay here again, but I would never pay the full rate. There are nicer hotels in the Loop at the same full price rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: I understand that things happen, but this went a bit too far, especially for a supposedly 4 star hotel. The first room had clearly not been vacuumed and one of the beds hadn't been remade. The second room smelled like smoke. We quickly began to be treated like annoying problem guests.....which I get, I've worked in retail and customer service, and I've been on the other end of those annoying people who always have a problem no matter what. But we were doing our best to be reasonable, but were completely treated like unreasonable irate crazy customers....eye rolls, exasperated sighs, etc. I wouldn't have thought about it again, but I just got Pricelined into this hotel for a trip to Chicago next week and it reminded me, and now I'm sorta wishing I wasn't stuck there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: kunkel5250
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt for 4 days, Aug 4-7. We had a lovely room, 3106. Great view being up high but would have rather had a view of the city skyline. The bed was super comfortable and the staff could not have been any more efficient or nice. My only problem, which was a large one, was the noise. I don't think that our room had any insulation! The first night there were kids in room 3101 celebrating their 21st birthday. The noise was ridiculous. Security was called up to their room several times and it did finally settle down, but not until well after midnight. We could hear any little noise in the hallways and very early the next morning people started getting up and slamming their doors. We got virtually no sleep that night. We did tell the front staff this and we were told to let them know if we had any other concerns. But what can they do? As much as I thought the hotel was lovely, I am not sure that I will return based on the noise. We could even hear the people next door talking! That being said, the staff does go out of its way to help you. We took both taxi's and the #3 bus. The bus is cheap, but can take quite some time. Taxi would cost us about $10 - $13 to get downtown. Breakfast at the hotel was delicious. We did not use any other amenities. My father works for Hyatt, so I have stayed in many of them throughout the country and I have to say that this staff were some of the best in any hotel. I just wish that we were able to get some sleep as that is what I was really paying for. We choose this hotel since it is close to IIT and that is where our daughter is going to college. Otherwise, it is really not close to anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Returning in a few weeks!"”
Reviews.Author: stephanie5656
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and love our view on the 17th floor. Staff was very friendly. I am returning on August 20th for 2 nights and looking forward to a city view room again. I can't say enough about this hotel - very professionally managed! P Barwise

Reviews.Title: “Just Decent”
Reviews.Author: dr_j_now
Reviews.Content: I will make it clear that I don't have any huge complaints about the hotel and didn't complain to the front desk about anything because I am very easy-going, but it just didn't quite live up to my expectations as a AAA 4 diamond hotel. I was upgraded for free to the executive suite, but I found the amenities to be rather lacking and will explain some in the next few sentences. Room seemed clean aside from the huge windows (they had huge greasy smudges all over as if the last guest(s) pressed their face against every window). Also, one night the top bed sheets had an obvious rip and hole in them as well. Just seemed like the attention to detail at this property was very lacking. Otherwise the staff seemed great and the rest of the hotel was very nice; I just wasn't impress by my room.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to be next to mccomicks place”
Reviews.Author: energydude
Reviews.Content: Clearly the convenience of being next to the convention center is the draw here. It's a haul to downtown so a taxi is needed to get anywhere else. Still the rooms are clean, comfortable and entirely adequate. I recommend this for any business traveller but I would not stay here for easy access to downtown as there are better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Had I known...”
Reviews.Author: iscream4life
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal off of Hotwire. First of all the hotel is very appealing. The furniture in the lobby and all over the hotel is very nice. It is away from the loudness of the city (which I missed). There was no conventions going on so it was very quiet. Like other reviews I have read, the bed was comfy and the room served its purpose. It was very hot in Chicago and my husband wanted to walk to Navy Pier from the hotel to save money on cab fare. Plus I didn't want to take the bus late at night. Not the brightest idea. It took a hour or so. At least we got a good workout and nice photos. However, that being said, we went up to the concierge before our walk and asked how much a cab would be from Navy Pier. From some of the reviews on here it would have been nice to know there was a shuttle to downtown and Navy Pier from the hotel. Unless it is only during the week. For that I'm very disappointed in this hotel and the customer service that was presented. Furthermore the lady behind the desk when we checked in was a bit rude when I asked for a room on a higher floor. The pool is actually quite small. We ate at the Mix and it took forever to get our food and drinks. They ran out of olives but the nice lady offered to take 20% off. Overall, we actually enjoyed ourselves at this hotel, but again customer service goes a long way and sadly it didn't go that far on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the city!”
Reviews.Author: rokeedy
Reviews.Content: We found a great special on this hotel for a weekend stay in the city that included breakfast and free parking. We were in town for a baseball game and they had a hotel shuttle that took us downtown. Great spot for families on a budget looking to find a nice hotel in the city. The only downer was the hotel water went out when I was in the shower once, but they were very courteous and brought us a fruit basket for the trouble. It can happen anywhere! Great indoor pool that my son enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Next to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Deah
Reviews.Content: Stayed (again) at the Hyatt McCormick for a conference. The location is great, right across from the convention center. There are two walkways that get you to the convention center when the weather does not cooperate. The Fitness Center is good, although a bit on the small side for the hotel size. We especially like the free shuttle that goes to Navy Pier. The only down side to the hotel is the lack of good restaurants in the immediate area. If going to a convention or sporting event at Soldier Field-Hyatt McCormick will always be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option.”
Reviews.Author: SK_Sun_Girl
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Priceline for our family vacation. I knew we wanted to stay near downtown and this was the closest we could get. The hotel room was nice and clean. I just wished it would have had Queen beds instead of doubles. I also wish they wouldn't have charged us $30 a night for parking. Or that we would have known that before booking - nothing you can do once you commit on Priceline. The hotel was quiet enough since there weren't any big conferences going on at the time. Wifi costs extra. That was a surprise since we are used to getting it for free. (Tip - wifi is free at the convention centre.) One night we walked to Brandy's Pizza for dinner and it was quite good. We used the number 3 bus a lot to go downtown. The hotel wouldn't sell us all day bus passes though - had to get those from Walgreens. The pool has no frills. There is an outdoor sun deck. The gym was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Trimommy2009
Reviews.Content: I will say this, the location is perfect if you are there for a conference at McCormick place. You don't even have to go outside. However, the interior was not so great. Maybe it was just my room though. There were tiles falling off in the shower, the "Almost Queen" is really a full size bed. I tried to swim in the lap pool one night and it was in dire need of a cleaning. I got tired of looking at all the floating yuck after about 15 minutes. The taxi line was a complete mess! Everyone jams into the lobby making it next to impossible to get your baggage from the bellman and I even more impossible to figure out who is in what line. I ended up waiting for over 45 minutes both times I needed a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, remote location”
Reviews.Author: GeneD5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern, with a good bar and friendly staff. I stayed here because of a conference at McCormick Place next door, but unfortunately, it's a cab ride or a walk and train ride to the Inner Loop and downtown Chicago's attractions. My room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravels09
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire for a GREAT price. Loved the hotel. Staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean. Great location. Walking distance to the Shedd Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view on the city”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy0
Reviews.Content: Spend two nights in this hotel in a room on the 21st. floor with city view. Check-in was smooth and fast and the staff is very helpful. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed and shower. Best part of the room is the view on the city, which especially at night is awesome. The hotel is a bit away from downtown, but taxis are cheap and always available. Easy walk to Soldier Field. The hotel in the restaurant was a bit expensive for my taste, approx. 55 $ for coffee, tea, juice and two omelets, including tax + tip. All in all a great stay, thanks to the great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for family trip”
Reviews.Author: tebower
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here after the hotel accepted a great Priceline deal (thank you for accepting Priceline, it helped us get to experience a Chicago trip when funds are usually an issue for us). The hotel definately exceeded our expectations. I saw the mixed reviews here and comkented to my wife that I couldn't believe that some people claimed to have such filthy rooms, etc. I doubt the hotel has a block of rooms that are kept dirty for some people. It is more likely that the people writing the reviews were blowing one small issue out of proportion. My family actually loved the location...close enough to downtown, the museums, and the 12th Street Beach, to be convenient and feel like you are "in the city," yet far enough to get a break from the noise, hustle and bustle. We came prepared to take public transportation, because we would not be paying through the nose for parking. The passes sold by the desk were wonderful to have available, and the number 3 bus was very convenient. We even walked down Cermak to get to the L station in order to experience riding the L train (red line). It was a nice 10 minute walk, and the neighborhood didn't feel unsafe. If I am coming back, I would stay here again for sure (as long as my Priceline bids are still accepted!) Thank you! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RVer40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and clean. The rooms are spacious, spotless bathrooms, and ample amenities. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is a Starbucks, and Italian Restaurant, and one other restaurant. The one drawback is there are no restaurants within walking distance so you either eat in the hotel restaurants or catch a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “SIR Trip”
Reviews.Author: ek1193
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quiet and clean. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, friendly, and perfect for my mini-vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Acause
Reviews.Content: I did plenty of research for this hotel before getting an excellent deal on Priceline. I was a little apprehensive because of some of the reviews. Here were my findings: ---WOW! This hotel was fantastic! It's not the closest to the happening spots downtown, but they are extremely easy to get to. I both took a cab (which can get pricey, but it can be as low as $7 a trip) and took the bus. The bus is perhaps the best deal, but you'd better be willing to wait up to an hour to get to your destination (eg: Water Tower to the hotel! Ouch! That took a bit of time, but the price was right). ---My friend and I were visiting Chicago to see Britney Spears' Femme Fatale tour at the United Center. This hotel was a perfect compliment to a wonderful spectacle! ---Parking was easy to find, and the McCormick Place area is quite beautiful. The modern architecture and the fountains were so peaceful. ---Shirley was our receptionist when we checked in, and WOW----she was splendid! She was very helpful and had a fantastic personality. She really did the trick in welcoming us to Chicago and to this wonderful hotel. ---Our room was tastefully done and very clean. I loved the shampoos and soaps. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was quiet, and we had an excellent view of the front of the hotel and Lake Michigan. We were beyond thrilled! ---After our show we went back to our hotel for a midnight snack, unfortunately there was nothing open and nothing walking distance to the hotel for us to enjoy (unless you count McDo, but we weren't that starving). The options in the snack machine were uninteresting and dull. ---We enjoyed breakfast at the Daily Grind. The women were efficient (not very chipper at all) and made one heck of a mocha. The pain au chocolat was nice. ---I was sad to leave, and I WILL return. I was very pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you not in a convention don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Trustydonkey
Reviews.Content: If you like spending money on Internet and parking stay here. About an hour walk to anything good. If you don't stay on a high floor then you are missing out on the one good thing about the hotel ...... The view

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: bgould1001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for the U2 concert. Rate was reasonable for the city, location was excellent as bus, subway, cabs were only steps away. 5 blks to soldier field, bus was outside the hotel (#3) which takes you up and down Michigan ave, was able to get a fun pass at the desk for 5 $ and able to ride all day/night. Service was excellent, desk staff were friendly and enjoyed their work. Room was superb. Starbucks in the lobby but we spent little time at the hotel and enjoyed the city. Can't wait to come back for another weekend. On the downside, the internet is 10$/day and the parking is 30$/day.

Reviews.Title: “It wasnt what I thought”
Reviews.Author: RainbowDiva
Reviews.Content: We checked in and the clerk made all types of promises and did not know where local food eateries where. We were told it was three blocks but it was six blocks. Our shower curtain was filthy and the housekeeper was notified. I had to call the operator to get a supervisor to bring us a new one. The room cleanliness was not what I expected at the Hyatt with room rates at $129.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpfull staff, great gym, so so room”
Reviews.Author: Oinkeater
Reviews.Content: The room allowed me to remain close to the ongoing convention, the gym was great, bar and restaurants were also good. The room could have used some attention, especially the cigarette odor from the A/C vent, chipped paint, and some other minor issues. Also wished there was a mini bar in the room as the convenience store in the lobby closed around 7. You will also never feel lonely as you can hear your neighbors talking...

Reviews.Title: “nice option for the views”
Reviews.Author: mn_family04
Reviews.Content: we stayed here to attend an event at SOldier Field, so wanted something within walking distance. I went blindfolded as I used Hotwire and could not know what hotel it was until after making the reservation. We were pleased. Although it is not right on downtown, we were able to walk to the stadium and the museum area, a cab to grant park is just around $8 and from there you can walk wherever you want. the rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly and pleasant. We drove there and arrived early... so we were worried we couldn't get a room until 3pm.... not at all, we walked up to the counter and were greeted nicely, the girl at the counter checked for us if there were any rooms available at that time... I even went over and asked for a room with a nice view and she went the extra mile to search and got us a room that early with an excellent view of all downtown and the lake. If I had to say something though.... it would be that the room was a little dated and there is not enough sound proofing to the hallways as you can listen in to everything that goes on in the hallways.... BUT, for the views we had and the friendly staff I don't mind that.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous + Friendly + Classy!!”
Reviews.Author: SteelyJan
Reviews.Content: After a 5 hour delay at the airport due to bad weather we arrived in Chicago at 3 in the morning. I had mixed up some reservations and at first they didn't have a room for us but offered us a parlour with pull out couch and roll away bed...that didn't sound very nice, but they promised to switch us in the morning. Fortunately I actually had confirmed on line and our room was secure but my sister, nephew and niece's weren't. They agreed. Well, it turns out they had a beautiful suite on a high floor with wrap around windows for 1/2 the price of the regular room, so guess what? They decided to keep it. they were also given $50. in food and bar credit. This is accommodating and then some. Everything was beautiful,Both our rooms had beautiful views. Clean, quiet. The staff was so nice and friendly. the breakfast buffet was stellar! I'm an artist and really appreciated the decor. So much artwork, exquisite colors, plants.. I didn't see the pool and workout room. All in all this is a good choice for Chicago, maybe a little out side the main city but the traffic is nothing like New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great convention hotel !”
Reviews.Author: StaryBaba
Reviews.Content: Hotel services have measurably improved since my last stay in May 2008. Staff are more customer-friendly than previously, and more voluntarily hepful. Because this hotel is rather isolated from Michigan Avenue activity, it is important that there is a variety of food and restaurant services available. Room service is good to adequate. Forno and Shor are excellent hotel-scale restaurants with pleasing menus. The in-house convenience store has an excellent selection of to-go fruit, sandwiches, and soft drinks. Recommend flying in and out of Midway Airport if at all possible, as the taxi ride from this hotel, even in rush-hour traffic, to Midway is 30 minutes max versus 2.5-3 hours in wild and woolly stop-and-go traffic to O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK but would not go out of my way to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Allis0nT
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I scored this hotel deal on Hotwire to stay in Chicago for memorial weekend. The hotel itself was nice, clean, and comfortable. We definitely needed a car since the hotel was a bit far from public transportation. Parking is $30/day- a fee they only disclosed at check-out. I was very disappointed at this but the manager was unable to help in any way. The gym is nice enough- clean and air conditioned. There is a sauna and swimming pool. Overall, I wouldn't scramble to stay here again and especially not at full price.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a nearby 4 star hotel with Hyatt quality”
Reviews.Author: DaveyChuck
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate Hyatt hotel, modern, clean, and comfortable. It's not in the Loop, but it's a very short bus ride to the action. The South Side was clean and safe - even upscale - not the Baddest Part of Town of its reputation. Very close to Chinatown. There isn't much in the neighborhood (though the local barbecue and fish shacks looked enticing, I just didn't have time) as it is the Convention Center, but if you're lucky you'll get a city or Lake view room. Some kids were having their prom the weekend I was there and it was just a delight to see all those young people dressed up and having fun. If you really need to stay in the Loop, do so. But don't go looking for a reasonable room off the beaten path and then complain about it! The rooms and the hotel were just lovely and modern and comfortable. I don't know why people complain so much about good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: abconkey1998
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. We got a great price on Hotwire for Memorial weekend. The staff was friendly and the concierge was very helpful. We asked for a room wih a good view and they gave us a room with a great view of downtown and Navy Pier. We could even see the Navy Pier fireworks on saturday night from our room. The room was spacious and up to date. The exercise facilities were big and well equipped. The pool was small but the kids didn't seem to mind a bit. While not located in the most convenient spot we found it very easy to get around town. We bought the $5.75 CTA bus pass for the day and it took us everywhere we needed to go...museums, magnificent mile, restaurants, etc. My only complaint about this hotel is the lack of an affordable place to eat breakfast with kids. However, we did find a McDonald's within walking distance of the hotel to cover breakfast. Overall, a great visit and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service”
Reviews.Author: Kyndra7
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hyatt go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are clean and spacious. It is a little far from downtown, but there is a bus stop on the corner and cabs are always on standby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay would stay again if $80.00 or less”
Reviews.Author: lb4ally
Reviews.Content: Over all staying here was ok, although I expected a bit more from a 4 star hotel in Chicago but to be fair, it is Chicago where they charge a fortune for everything. If I had paid full rate instead of using priceline, I would have never stayedâ€¦ When I check on their website for dates in June 2011, the rooms are over $300.00 a night. If I paid that, my review would go much differentlyâ€¦. unless they have different rooms for priceline users???? If this were a 3 star hotel I would have rated it higher, mainly due to the staff in the lobby. Pros: Staff was friendly, professional, and extremely helpful and lots of them too. Rooms were clean and roomy, separate double sink space from toilet and shower, flat screen TV, good location (close to the loop for tourist), rooms well equipped with the usual plus there was a NICE hair dryer and tooth paste. Cons; The view was a parking lotâ€¦. awful (I guess I should have asked to be moved but we were tired and who knows what we would have been moved to), the bed was too hard for me, we had the air on max but it was still too warm to sleep, $30.00 parking (I know, I know, they all do itâ€¦ but still), charges for local calls (didnâ€™t know that until I checked out), room dÃ©cor was just ok (more like a 3 star), all you can eat breakfast was $20.00 ( I didnâ€™t eat but my boyfriend did and he said it was better than average as far as a buffet goâ€™s), no refrigerator in room. I advise to buy bus passes at the front desk! $5.75 for 24 hrs (or check with Chicago transit, you may find a longer pass). A bus may take a little longer to get to the other end of Michigan but its well worth it and surprisingly clean. Every bus driver was friendly and helpful. I recommend talking with a hotel staff member for info on connections, they can get confusing. Mitchell Sheley was extremely knowledgeable, which Iâ€™m sure most of them are but he not only gave us directions for the busses, he educated us as well. I would only recommend if you don't pay more than $100.00 or $120.00- I would never pay more than that here, remember you have to add $30.00 a night parking and tat is pushing most budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room and staff - just take a cab for going out!”
Reviews.Author: jpminard
Reviews.Content: I can't compliment the staff enough at this Hyatt location. This was my first stay after attaining Diamond Status and all I can say is that while I'm sure I may top this room later on, we have certainly started off with a bang. Fantastic view, fantastic room and fantastic staff. Yes, you need to grab a quick cab ride if your intention is to head out pretty much anywhere, but when you pay half to a third of the price of the Park Hyatt for the room, a few cab rides are chump change and a simple trade-off. We'll definitely use this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sluggo65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight with my partner for a night out in Chicago. The hotel screams "15 years old" and is badly in need of a revamp. There are not enough amenities open late, since there is very little around the area. The views south are just ugly. I'm sure the views north to the city are great, but i didn't want to pay the $30 upcharge. You can get better deals more centrally located downtown (especially on Priceline) than this, esp if you want to sightsee, because this hotels literally out of the Loop. The bedroom was a very standard mid-level hotel room. Desk. Bed. Arimoire. Nothing very special, but nothign awful either. The bathroom, however was as plain as could be and very out of date. It also had some water staining behind the toilet, and some scuffs on the bathroom ceiling (don't want to know!) Other annoyances: - closet had a tacky curtain instead of doors - no mini bar - no fridge All in all, not the worst hotel ever, but very middle of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: tmccullough
Reviews.Content: The only thing that is good about this hotel is the convenience to the convention center. It has been nice to go back and forth. But for the amount of money we're paying, it's a terrible value. For being a business hotel, I think the internet cost is outrageous. I have two laptops here and I get to pay double to have them both online. I think the $10 charge should cover as many devices as I want. Don't get me started on parking. $30 a day. Ouch! I'm here for 7 days, so it would be nice to have a mini fridge. I guess I'll store some sandwiches in the ice bucket.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Although Not Convenient to Most Chicago Tourist Attractions”
Reviews.Author: kitkathleen
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel on Priceline for $90/night. After reading the other reviews on Tripadvisor, I must agree that this hotel is not ideally located for those Chicago tourists that are not there for a convention. I spent about $100 on taxis over the weekend-I was travelling with small children though. The taxi stand line on Saturday evening at 5:00 PM had more than 80 people in it. This is an good indication that this is not a destination hotel and that there aren't enough taxis to support the hotel population during peak times. The restaurants are okay. Check in was friendly as were all the other hotel staff. The room was clean and well mantained. Housekeeping did a great job. There is a McDonalds in the Convention Center but other than that, the hotel restaurants, a sushi bar and a pub (neither great for kids) you will be taking some kind of transportation to eat. This hotel does have TERRIFIC views of the city and the lake, I would ask check in for a room with a view. You can park for FREE on the same street as the Hyatt's front entrance. Just drive by the hotel and continue one block and there is free parking on the street (don't know name) flanked by brick buildings. My car was fine over the weekend. Self park was $30 and valet was more....

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUstinov
Reviews.Content: Like all Chicago hotels, I found the staff friendly, helpful and professional. The common areas are well-appointed and the fitness center was great.. Our room was clean and pleasant but the furnishings and layout were dated and drab and I'm not that picky. Our first room had the most depressing view of the McCormick Conference Center - a truly ugly, sprawling series of gargantuan buildings. We asked for a room on the other side and they moved us right away. At night we then had a great view of the Chicago skyline. The onsite restaurant has a lavish buffet breakfast. Dinner was a disaster - they tried hard, it's a nice room but the food was overcooked and 2 inches of cheese on everything. The internet service was atrocious - had to call their tech every day. They deleted the charge but it was frustrating to get bumped of of VPN and lose work because of recurring issues they were having with relay points. We stayed here because we were recruiting at a big conference. The problem is that this hotel is located in an industrial/seamy neighborhood that is a $12.00 cab ride to any place you would want to be as a visitor. There is NOTHING nearby in terms of shopping. I caught a cold and had to pay $10.00 each way to get to the nearest Walgreen's Pharmacy in a seamy neighborhood. If I ever have to go to a conference at McCormick again, I will stay downtown and take a cab. There is no reason to stay in this locale.Chicago is a beautiful city with great, inexpensive hotels downtown and in the neighborhoods. This hotel has mediocre rooms in a dismal, unsafe area. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “This is not Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
