Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and regretted it, solely due to the location. It is far away from central/downtown Chicago and I missed not being in the activity of the the City. Closest comparision would be an airport hotel. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Conference at McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: MurphyNh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights while at a one day conference. Out of the way from downtown but a bus ride into Michigan Avenue was fine...take Bus#3, we mistakenly got onto Bus#21 going up and down Cermak...not an area you want to see as a tourist. It detoured us almost 2 hours because we didn't want to get out in certain areas. We laugh about it now...we are country hicks :) The hotel service is great, the lobby furniture is very tired...needs updating. We stayed on the 15th floor in the corner so it was quiet...didn't hear all the noise as other travelers had complained about. Beds were super comfortable as were the pillows. There were no frills...anything additional you had to pay for...a bottle of water in the room, internet in the room, using computers in business center and printing. I'm used to getting all that with the room and stay. Didn't eat onsite so can't review that.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: bterry25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for the whole family. We are just a quick taxi ride into downtown about $8 each way. We booked the hotel with AAA what a deal, the free breakfast food and service was impressive. Each person cares about your stay and they want to help you anyway they can. If you eat at the shore ask for Luz, loves kids and does a great job. Occupancy was low during our stay and the upgraded us to an executive suite with a great view. Room 2433 has full view of the water all the way north and south ask for a corner suite when u stay period.

Reviews.Title: “A good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oliviauk
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is part of the convention centre and a good choice if you are visiting an exhibition. It's a 10 minute taxi ride to the centre of Chicago or 20 minutes with the bus that stops just in front of the hotel. The building is impressive, modern and welcoming. If you have a room on the higher floors you can enjoy great city and lake views. Staff is welcoming, polite, efficient and ready to accommodate any needs you may have. The rooms are typical of a chain hotel, nothing special but nothing missing. The doors do have an inch gap on the side and the bottom, so the noise from other doors opening and closing is disturbing. Breakfast buffet is very nice with a large choice of food but at $20 it does not come cheap. This can also be said from the Wi-fi charge of $10 a day. The Hyatt does have a very well equiped gym with the latest equipment. It is very busy when the hotel is full but outside rush hour offers a great opportunity to exercise. Overall a good choice if you need to visit the McCormick centre but there are better options if visiting down town Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: RobOesterle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. The room was very clean and well-kept. We arrived before the main restaurant opened on Friday, so we had an appetizer and a burger in the MIX Lounge, both of which were surprisingly good. We were frequent visitors to The Daily Grind, the coffee shop in the lobby. We were able to buy all-day bus passes at the front desk, which made the out-of-the-way location not nearly as big a bother. The only thing we wish they would have had was a hot tub in the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for business without feeling trapped in hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SRPINOKC
Reviews.Content: Most of our group stayed here for ProMat, primarily for the convenience of the connection to the convention center. We were asked immediately if we'd like a later check out, which was nice for such a hectic overnite trip. My room was well appointed, clean and offered beautiful views of Soldier field and Navy Pier in the distance. Also an easy ride from Midway via the "L" orange line north and connected to the Metra Electric green line (this will require a pass for each, $2.25 for each leg). Lots of room to roam, food selections are good and bar area large enough to accomodate large groups coming from convention. Good experience and I'd recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great service just when I needed it”
Reviews.Author: MN_young_travelers
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, Amtrak put me up in this hotel when my connecting train was cancelled. After spending all day traveling and then in lines at Union Station, I was eager to settle in and relax. Though there was only one staff person checking our Amtrak group in, he processed us all quickly. What a relief to not wait in yet another endless line! He was extremely friendly and professional. When I requested a toiletry that he didn't immediately have handy, he said he'd have it brought up to me. It was delivered within 60 seconds of me walking in to my room! Every staff member was very friendly. My room was modern, very clean, and in good condition (I did see a couple of curling-iron burns on the counter, no big deal). The amenities were nice, with a couple of exceptions: the towels were small, scratchy, and cheap, closer to Super 8 quality than what I'd expect from a Hyatt. The TV remote was also old and didn't work very well (weak batteries, maybe?) though the TV was new. I found the bed comfortable, which was much appreciated after traveling. The view from my room was beautiful, too. As other reviewers have said, the walls are on the thin side. I could hear my neighbors' conversations, showers, etc. more than I expected to. The common facilities are nice, too, from what I saw. Lots of lobby areas, an extensive (and predictably expensive) gift/snack/coffee shop, and fast elevators. The business center does not provide free computer use, and wifi isn't free either. This was an unpleasant discovery when I needed a few minutes online to sort out my travel options. They do offer a "boarding pass" computer/printer in the lobby which is nice. My stay here was quite short (about 9 hours) so I can't claim to have experienced everything. From what I did experience, I'll be happy to return to the Hyatt when I am next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Overload”
Reviews.Author: heatheranddrew
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8p.m. on Thursday evening. We were greeted by a friendly staff. We asked lots of questions of what they recommend for us to do while we were there. They gave us lots of info. We thought the hotel was very pretty and clean. We had a wonderful view. We ate at the restaurants and bar area while we were there and the food and service was spectacular. They had a couple of large groups there for some conferences. So at times they got very busy. The staff was very organized and held their composure while dealing with the mounds of people. They didn't seem bothered or rushed when I had some questions to ask. We would differently recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Chicago area and hope to return again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: ashleycraig84
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Hyatts, and this one simply did not live up to my expectations. The staff seemed stressed and overworked. There definitely was a lack of attention to details. Parking was pretty pricey, which is expected, but the valet staff was outright rude at times. I've stayed at Hyatts in Kansas City, St. Louis, and Hawaii; all of them were heads above this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: Shan11611
Reviews.Content: I came down with 4 friends this past weekend mainly to watch the Chicago Bears playoff game and also to sightsee and stayed at the Mccormick place.We paid $55 per night through priceline. The hotel is gorgeous....very clean and comfortable. The staff is awesome and extremely friendly and helpful. Parking cost us $30 per night. We got connecting rooms which was super convenient for us to all hang out together. The hotel is super close (15 minute walk) to Soldier field....we even walked back halfway thru tailgating to put on more socks. We cabbed downtown a few times during our trip, and paid between $12-$15 per ride. If you're going to be spending all your time d/t, then it would probably be more worthwhile to stay at the hyatt downtown, but because we were going to soldier field as well, this hotel was perfect. The only drawbacks I found were that they charged $.47 /per minute to use internet in the lobby and their coffee shop/gift shop closed super early. Overall, we were all extremely satisfied with this stay and would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hot on the outside, lukewarm on the inside...”
Reviews.Author: bravebird75
Reviews.Content: What Impressed Me: -Beautiful building (it's pretty tall and elegantly modern inside) -The doorman/valet combo at the main entrance -Four-star treatment by the hotel staff -Plenty of parking -Room design -The double sinks What Didn't Impress Me: -Parking fees (I know it's 4-star, but come onnnn...) -The beds -The thin walls -The view from the room -The location -The jacked up sink So here's the deal. This is a pretty nice hotel--I wouldn't rave and brag about it being 4-star because in so many respects, when I laid my head down to sleep every night, I still felt like I was sleeping in a 3-star hotel room. My boyfriend and I won 2 nights here through Priceline for a holiday, so we understood that we really weren't in any position to complain about much. However, there were a couple of things that we THOUGHT would be expected, considering that we were still at a supposedly fancy place. 1. The walls are INCREDIBLY thin. If you stayed in that hotel with us that weekend, we could tell you everything that you did. We knew when you went to the bathroom. We knew when you showered. We knew when you fought in your hotel room three doors down for 2 hours. And we knew that your devilish 5-year-old did NOT want to take a bath, go eat breakfast, or do anything else that you politely asked them to do. They really should do something about the walls. 2. I appreciate the plethora of parking...especially since the hotel is in a major city. But when that doorman told us that daily parking was $33 and valet was $45, we almost had a heart attack. lol I guess that's more of a heads up for everyone. 3. You'd think that SOME of the money they're milking out of everyone would go towards the beds, considering that that's really what you're paying for. I know hotels aren't really using real boxsprings anymore, but the things that these mattresses were resting on were horrible! They made noises uncomfortable. They were cheap, wherever they got them from. We actually spent the next 2 nights at a run-of-the-mill Marriott in Detroit, and their beds--amazing! Felt like I was in a 4-star bed...kinda how I thought I was going to feel when I slept here. This alone made me want to never stay at this hotel again. Yes, I understand you pay for the name when you stay at this kind of hotels, but I mean, a bed is a standard luxury. If you're going to act like you're a luxury hotel, get a luxury bed! Or at least one that you can sleep in (not ON, in!) Great big fail on this front, guys. Minus one star. 4. I had a sink that took forever to process. It kind of annoyed me! You'd think this could be easily fixed with some Drain-o. Not a big deal, but it urked me. Good thing we had to sinks to work from. All in all, it really is a beautiful hotel. The decor inside is amazing, and the restaurants looked lovely (we chose to eat inside the city instead of splurging on hotel food). And you'd think with it being as tall as it is, the views would be better, but from our room, it really wasn't much. Doesn't help that it's not in the best part of Chicago--don't worry, you're not in the "hood" by any means, but you're definitely not in the thriving bustle of the city. So there you have it! Four star on paper, three star (to me) in reality. Will I stay there again? Not if I have a choice! I'm a little spoiled when it comes to my sleep. Would I recommend staying there? Only if you have to, or if you're like us, and happened to win it somehow. No need to run from it, but there's no need to run and tell your friends either.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, worth the distance from the city”
Reviews.Author: elizarenn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt for the entire month of July, and I was treated as a special guest every day, even though I obviously had a discounted rate as part of a group. My room was extremely comfortable -- one of the best beds I've ever slept in at a hotel -- and the view of downtown Chicago was superb. Every Saturday night I was entertained by a fireworks show off Navy Pier, and I could see it all from my wall of windows. The staff members were extremely accommodating, doing everything they could to help me feel at home during my month-long stay. If I needed extra hangars, they were in my room within five minutes. One staff member actually helped me carry a heavy box to FedEx in McCormick Place to ship before I left. The hotel is often quite busy, and the elevators sometimes get busy, but the lobby areas are expasive and comfortable. There is a #3 bus stop right out front that will take you all the way down Michigan Avenue, so the distance from the city wasn't that much of a setback. The area was nice, and I even walked around the neighborhood at night and would see families walking their dogs (depending on which direction you turn as you leave the hotel...). The indoor pool is crowded with kids and noisy -- not the best -- but the weight room is large and not usually that busy. After my month-long stay in July, I went back a second time in August. They gave me a great room even though I had booked it through a discount site because I was a repeat customer. Really love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: schlazzy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough but maybe a little on the decline. The city views are EXCELENT and its not too far from downtown. We walked it and took a taxi back for less than $10. Finding a place to park was no problem either- there is an entire street of free parking on the west side of the convention center (one block away). They also had a nice workout facility with sauna. If you are expecting a palace keep looking but for the money it was nice. One drawback was the depth of the tub, trying to get underwater I splashed probably a good five gallons on the marble floor. ; P The other reviewers were right about the walls not being sound proof. All in all it was good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, nice people, expensive parking and internet”
Reviews.Author: jadams5454
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed for the weekend as part of the Mayor Daley Sports fest. A few years, the place was crazy but this year, much nicer. The staff was very friendly -- not worn down! The room was great with plenty of space for the three of us. Would have loved valet parking and internet to have been included. A bit expensive at $30 and $15 per day day respectively.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you got”
Reviews.Author: DannoE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located at the McCormick Place where I attended a convention. I know I paid a premium for this hotel for the location but the room could have been nicer for the price. The furniture was worn and should have been replaced. On top of the expensive room, internet was an additional cost of $15 per day. The bed was comfortable and had a wide variety of type pillows to choose from. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs vacuum attachments”
Reviews.Author: cornflks
Reviews.Content: Great location for my daughter's dance convention at McCormick Place. The staff was friendly. The free shuttle to the museums and Water Tower Place is great. $10-15 internet is not acceptable. The rooms have dark carpet and the lint really shows. Housekeeping need an attachment on their vacuums to get the corners and edges of the carpet. Bathroom mirror was caked with someone else's toothpaste and sink splash. The walls are thin. We could hear the conversation of the people next door clearly through the walls. When the convention let out, elevators were a nightmare. Waiting 10+ minutes to go up or down. Self serve parking was great. Easy to use. Would recommend this hotel only if you were attending an event at McCormick place.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy and far away”
Reviews.Author: nhigh2
Reviews.Content: Sad to say, that there was another convention of college students here while I am here visiting (for a conference). I'm being woken up at 4 a.m. from loud noise. And there's a party next door that is keeping me from doing my work. Don't come here if you have to get work done. Also, there's nothing within walking distance, so you're confined to the hotel, unless you want to take a taxi. Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: mikeyDoylestown_PA
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Hyatt Mc Cormick place last wk, came back home with bites on my arms & right foot, On line, they look like bed bugs are itchy & all in a straight line. 6 on my right foot & lines on both arms . any other reports of bed bugs at this hotel. Now, I think I have brought them home with me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gamcr
Reviews.Content: I read some of the comments after I did the reservation and I was kind of scare of some of them. We had 11 rooms because we run Chicago Marathon and everything turned out to be great. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are very well decorated, good space. The front desk, the bell boys, the concierge very very helpful and really nice people. Excellent attention from the staff. It is true that it is not in downtown but a cab of 14$ or the bus in front of the hotel is not difficult at all. The reception desk even sold the metro cards. Very nice detail of the hotel to have a pasta dinner the previous night and a shuttle for the runners and family to the start of the marathon.

Reviews.Title: “People on here are too fussy sometimes”
Reviews.Author: pschneid221
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's not in the best part of downtown but the bus stops right in front of the hotel and within 5-10min you're in the heart of Chicago... Great hotel, courteous staff, very clean..... Priceline, $80.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Rosebriar2
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the weekend at the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place. The hotel itself is clean and the staff is friendly -- both definite pluses in my book. Unless you're staying for a conference, however, there isn't much actually near the hotel. It's nearly four miles to the Navy Pier and two or three miles to Millennium Park, which can be a bit far if you're traveling primarily on-foot. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, but the bathroom had virtually no counter space. (We had to keep our toiletries in the bedroom.) We also had a room near the stairs and could hear people (both staff and guests) stomping up and down the stairs. The hotel's restaurant (Shor) had a number of options at varying price points, which I appreciated. We had a good meal there on our first night and it was reasonably priced. One last note: Though our room was cleaned and the common lobbies were in good shape, two room service trays sat in our hallway for more than 15 hours. We first noticed the trays around 8 p.m. on Saturday night and they still hadn't been collected at 11 a.m. on Sunday. Not really the kind of thing I want to see every time I walk to and from my room. Pros: -Clean lobby -Welcoming and helpful front desk and lobby staff -Large room -Free work-out room, pool -Hotel restaurant (Shor) had good food at a number of price-points Cons: -Hotel isn't within easy walking-distance of much -Room service trays stayed in the hallway for hours -Business center rates were ridiculously high, staff was unfriendly -Bathroom counter is tiny! -Work out room is open 24-hours, but adjacent pool has limited hours Overall, this hotel was decent and there weren't any glaring issues, but I think my money would have been better-spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin6372
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt McCormick Place for 8 nights (Sept 7 - 14, 2010) while parent was patient at University of Chicago Medical Center. We reserved 2 adjoining rooms/double beds for family members. We were impressed with this hotel in every way - staff, service, comfort, cleanliness. Our rooms were beautifully decorated and spacious. The location was perfect - 15 min from hospital. They offered special rate for U/C Med Center families. Parking was easy and safe. The $30 parking charge is typical of Chicago hotels and because of the convenience, we paid it gladly. This hotel location is great if you want to be near Lake Shore Drive, University of Chicago, McCormick Place, Soldier Field, Museums, Navy Pier, and quick drive to the Loop. Thanks to the management and front desk personnel for an excellent 'retreat' to rest from hours spent at the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience-helpful staff, comfortable bed & nice sized room”
Reviews.Author: Pleased3
Reviews.Content: The location is good. We bought a 24 hour bus pass and rode the # 3 Bus downtown to great shopping and restaurants...just ask at the front desk; they will direct you and you can purchase the pass there. You can get off at Grand and switch to another bus or walk to Navy Pier. The hotel is within walking distance of Soldier Field. The rooms are nice and the beds comfortable. it was clean and the staff helpful.We found that public transportation and taxis were far cheaper that renting a car and more fun and relaxing than driving ourselves. We also stayed for 5 days in Sept and the stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room But We Didn't Get Much Sleep in it!”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: We moved our daughter back to college in Chicago, and her apartment building has a special rate with this Hyatt. Normally we stay closer to the city center. We were upgraded to a corner suite, and the room was very nice with a sitting area, kitchen and dual sinks in the bathroom. The views of the city and the lake were very great. The bed was comfortable, and the hot water plentiful. Sadly all the good was negated by the negative. Understanding that this is a conference hotel, we expected some noise in the hallways. But in all my years of travel I have never stayed at a hotel where doors slammed all night long, and people talked, laughed and carried on in the hallways at all hours. A group of men came back to their rooms at 5:00 in the morning, followed by some guy who had locked himself out of his room. He banged on the door and called someone's name repeatedly until security finally showed up. Bottom line is that with this hotel's noise level, distance from the city, $30 a night for parking and no free internet, we will not stay here again when we come to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Overnight Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jruthg
Reviews.Content: Last month, while returning home via Amtrak, the train was greatly delayed (about eight hours) and many of us aboard missed connections in Chicago. The specifics of the Amtrak issue are for another review, but that incident resulted in my first experience with the Hyatt Regency/McCormick Place, the hotel for which Amtrak provided over-night vouchers. Several dozen tired passengers descended upon the hotelâ€™s reception staff very late on the evening of 18 August. [NOTE: Despite the late hour, no suspicious or "unsavory" characters were observed either in the lobby or outside in the driveway/drop off area.] As a veteran solo female traveler, believe me, I NOTICE things like that!] The Amtrak groupâ€”on the wholeâ€”was not especially happy, given the missed connections and the resulting confusion about rebooking. While I canâ€™t speak for any of the others, my observations of and dealings with the Hyatt staff suggest that they were unfailingly professional, patient, and charming as they collected the Amtrak vouchers and routed everyone to rooms. My room was delightfulâ€”clean, nicely decorated, furnished with a comfortable bed and a flat screen TV (albeit with skimpy channel choices). The bathroom was huge in comparison with one provided by another major hotel chain (in California, earlier in my trip). My only complaintâ€”a minor annoyanceâ€”was that several of us (assigned rooms on the same floor) thought we had malfunctioning key cards until security arrived to tell us that they are to be inserted/removed â€œslowly.â€� Most keycards I have encountered like a â€œquickâ€� trip through the reader. If operation speed is a known characteristic of this particular kind of keycard, the staff should inform guests upon issuing the card, rather than have the guest arrive at the room, find that the door remains locked, then has to hunt for a house telephone to summon help. Amtrak also provided cash stipends to each of us to defray meal and cab expenses. The next morning I used some of that cash to enjoy a tasty breakfast in the hotelâ€™s â€œShorâ€� restaurant. I was pleased to find French press coffee availableâ€”just like I have at home. Upon departing, the reception staff was cordial and the doorman was more than helpful in securing a cab and assisting with my luggage. Regarding parking fees: Obviously, I did not have a car to park on this occasion. On many trips, however, I do. Parking fees ranging as high as $50 per night (for self-parking) are not uncommon at major hotels in major cities. Often I find they are little more than very expensive â€œhunting licenses,â€� since many hotels do not (claim they â€œcannotâ€�) ensure that spaces are limited to paying guests/legitimate event attendees. Even when driving locally (I live in the Washington DC metro area) I am not surprised to find hourly parking fees in excess of $10 to $20, whether at hotels or other controlled public parking garages. The Hyattâ€™s charge of $30 per day is not, in my experience, especially high or unusual. What is, in my opinion, an excessive fee: Steep daily charges for Internet access. This comment applies to most large hotels, and is a concern noted by other reviewers of this one. It is my experience that Internet charges tend to be inversely proportional to the size of the hotel company. Many smaller hotels, in fact, offer free wireless/high speed connections. Yet, every time I am in a Marriott, Hyatt, Hilton, etc., 24-hour Internet fees run $10 to $12 or more. Perhaps (private sector) business travelers can voucher that cost. As a federal employee, I cannot. Do I have to incur those charges? No way! Two years ago I acquired an air card for my laptop. I suggest that other travelers consider that option for themselves. I travel frequentlyâ€”both alone for business and with family/friends for leisureâ€”and have had a variety of experiences with hotels and other lodging options around the US and in Europe. My brief, unexpected stay at this Hyatt Regency certainly compares favorably with other major hotel chains I have used. I do agree that, for visiting center-city Chicago sites, the McCormick Place location may not be optimal. The many transportation options in Chicago certainly could negate that concern, however. On balance, I would have no qualms about choosing the Hyatt Regency/McCormick Place for a future stay, apart from the fact that Chicago has so many well run, well placed, tempting options from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at this hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: luv2explore
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me start by saying that take all the Tripadvisor reviews with a grain of salt. I was very nervous before I checked into this hotel because of all the negative reviews, however I can state that I had absolutely a positive experience. The only major negative about this place (which can not be changed) is the location. Yes, it is somewhat of an inconvenience being a bit out of downtown area, however with a CTA bus pass, it is very convenient to get there. I won this hotel on Priceline and for the price I paid for a 4 star property, I easily overlooked this. The lobby is beautiful. My room had no issues like all the other posters speak about. I asked for a city view room, and was given an incredible room with a great view. I could easily see many of the Chicago attractions from my room. The elevators were fast; I did not feel I had to wait excessively at anytime. The last and the most important thing about this hotel was it's service. Everyone is very friendly and they truly go out of your way to make your stay comfortable. One example was when we needed to heat up milk for my child at around 11PM, we called the front desk and a manager opened up the coffee shop for us to use. Overall, I think it's a great place to stay if you can get a good deal on priceline, or are there for a convention, etc. I would recommend it. Some other notes: Internet---The hotel charges $9.99/day for internet -- lucky for me, I was able to connect to my droid and use the tethering feature to get internet on my laptop. Otherwise, I would not have been happy. Parking -- The hotel charges $30/day which is actually cheaper than alot of the other hotels I was looking at. Some of the central located hotels charge upto $50/day. However, I was able to locate a private parking spot in a condo building listed on craigslist.org. I paid $40 for the 5 days I was there. This worked out real well for me.

Reviews.Title: “the thug hyatt”
Reviews.Author: bemoresassy
Reviews.Content: My first disappointment came when I learned that we had to pay for parking. At every hotel I've stayed in as a guest parking was free. Second there were no microwave nor fridge in the rooms. I"m from Baltimore, MD even the "Ho-motels" have a fridge/microwave. The lobby and other places looked clean and beautiful but when you looked closely you saw cigcarett butts on the floor, trash was also on the floor and table and behind the one of the sofas were liquor bottles. I was outside at 3 a.m. smoking a cig and there were about 40 thug looking guys outside along with their ho looking girls. About 15 people got out of a hummer limo torn up from the floor up and a near fight was avoided when two guys broke it up. No I will not be staying at the Hyatt regency McCormickPlace again! I slept like a baby in the bed though. Also there prostute looking women in the lobby and outside of it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: cremebrulee0331
Reviews.Content: I was really confused about this place. It's Hyatt, right?? This is the most depressing Hyatt I've ever stayed in my whole life. The lobby was really nice, but that was about it. The rooms were old and worn out. The furnitures looked old and unclean. And they charge an arm and a leg for parking. Two nights in a row we could not find any parking space in their parking garage. We complained, and they said that they can't do anything about it because there's an event going on. The staff just seemed like they didn't care and did not want to help us. Really?? And we're paying customers!! The neighborhood was run down and there was nothing in the surrounding area. I would really not stay here if you're visiting Chicago for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Going to stay Again!! C. Nolin”
Reviews.Author: CNOLIN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago for my birthday weekend trip. We have stayed at many hotels in dwntown chicago, due to my husband's business. I would say hands down this hotel has the best city skyline views, by far!!!!! Yes, you do have to take a taxi to Navy Pier and attractions such as that, but you can walk to Soldier Field and The Museum. No, this is not the fanciest hotel that we have stayed in at Chicago but the nightly rate is fantastic and the parking is cheaper. Parking in more central hotels run much more. We are going again in Aug. 2010 for my birthday weekend I cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “JUST O.K.”
Reviews.Author: aFlyGirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the building was gorgeous from the street and being inside McCormick place was nice. Lobby was beautiful, staff were friendly, but our room was just o.k. My first issue was the big leather chair we saw as we entered our room, it was cracked and really old looking... not a great welcoming. The bathroom at first glance was decorated in a contemporary style, which I love, but there was hair on our towels! We were pretty grossed out! The bed was very comfy, I must say. We checked in between 4pm-5pm and housekeeping was still cleaning... we could here all kinds of noise through the walls, making it hard to get any sort of nap in before heading out for dinner. Speaking of heading out, keep in mind that as you walk northwest of the hotel, the neighborhoods get a little scary. There were lots of people just hanging out on the sidewalks, making it difficult to get to where you want to go, it made us feel a little unsafe. If I had to do it again, I would probably take a taxi directly from the hotel instead. We enjoyed the little cafe in the lobby, they had yummy coffee and we also found a hidden gem outside. They had an outdoor eating area that was really nice, we enjoyed the summer breeze that was coming through while we drank our Starbucks. Finally, the thing that rubbed us the wrong way is the parking situation. The Hyatt asks you to park your car in their parking structure and then pay $30 on top of your hotel room! We paid the money but then had a hard time being released from the structure. We had the receipt but we were made to wait for management to come check our receipt and be allowed out. We probably won't be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, Worse Food, Staff Tries ... But Marriott Does It Better”
Reviews.Author: SimonGreensboro_NC
Reviews.Content: Booked here by company for a conference, had some concerns after reading some of the reviews on Trip Adviser. The concerns were certainly justified. First, the location. South Side of Chicago, as Jim Croce sang, the baddest part of town. It's not the worst of the South Side, but it's not far off. The neighborhood is dicey and I wouldn't walk around here after dark. There is, literally, nothing in terms of decent food (or anything else) within easy walking distance. There is a decent tapas place a short cab ride away (Tapas Valencia) and a decent Italian cafe (Cafe Bionda, but watch out for the $15 house wine), otherwise, nothing. The hotel has a restaurant, but a 4 oz. steak is $35, plus they charge you $6 extra (!) for each side. Now that's arrogance. On top of that, the food is terrible. The potatoes they served were cold, the chicken was rubbery and could have bounced off the walls, and the crab cakes made most of the people in the group who ate them sick with the runs. The food was likely cooked in advance for the group and left to sit, or else someone didn't wash their hands properly. There is a pizza place downstairs, but in a town that's famous for its pizza, this place gets trounced by your average Domino's. I might expect this of a third or fourth rate hotel, but for a Hyatt? Really? For the most part, the staff makes a good effort, but it's spotty. Someone in the party had trouble trying to get to sleep with people in the corridor making noise, so she called security. What do they do? Come to her room to discuss the problem, with an open door, in full view and earshot of the people she was complaining about. Not very smart. The result was the people who were noisy made a point of slamming doors all night long to keep her up. She didn't call security again, fearing more trouble. On the plus side, (and it's not much, but at least it's something) they've made an effort with an improved fitness center. Still no bench or Olympic weights, but at least they've added some Life Fitness machines to the ubiquitous and generally useless Universal-type apparatus, so you can at least get a halfway decent workout. (I just wish the dumb bells didn't go up to only 50 lbs.) Do yourself a favor and, if you have a choice, do the Marriott. They do it better (although their fitness center is much worse. Go figure.)

Reviews.Title: “Not just location...”
Reviews.Author: trboyden
Reviews.Content: Being located near McCormick Place, it should be obvious that the Hyatt Regency is not going to be convenient to downtown. However there are many other shortcomings of this Hyatt that are not typical of most Hyatts. First, Wi-Fi access - in the 21st century, this should be free - no exceptions. Especially for a hotel that is supposed to be business focused. Second, cell phone dead zone. Again, cell phone providers provide free extenders to ensure good reception anywhere, its critical to their reputations. Hyatt needs to give them a call. Third, food options are extremely limited and the in hotel options are of poor quality and way too expensive. Finally, there is no free shuttle option to either the airports or downtown. Be prepared to suffer expensive cab rides or inconvenient public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it to yourself....”
Reviews.Author: REWEST
Reviews.Content: I sit at my desk 8/4/10, only to find that I've been double billed by this hotel for the third time. What was suppose to be an extended weekend vacation, has turned into a part-time nightmare, requiring my full-time attention. The trouble begins with a staff that simply won't listen - My stay was in Mid-June; Why am I being continuously billed? Anyhoo, the location wasn't that great, but if you find a city-bus ride adventurous, then you'll be fine. There are no dining options in the area, and the food at the hotel is overpriced, and really not of high quality. Our room was fine; no complaints here. It just wasn't a great experience, and it continues to disappoint two months later.

Reviews.Title: “Desolate Neighborhood, Poor Management, Depressing Stay”
Reviews.Author: StayOutGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in a recently gentrified area that hasn't been repopulated yet. We took a walk around the surrounding neighborhood and it was utterly desolate. No people, no stores, no restaurants, no bars, just block after block of "for lease" signs. SEVERAL blocks away we found a few carry-out places, but the people drinking outside calling me "snowflake" and "candy cane" as I walked by kept me from wanting to go inside. I felt bad for them, their shops and homes have been replaced with empty storefronts and luxury condos made for people that apparently don't want to live or open businesses there. Except for taking a few long city bus rides to more populated areas, we were stuck at the chaotic hotel, where it seemed everyone was having a problem with their room or reservation. Every elevator ride was another horror story from another guest - doors not locking and having to be fixed 4 times, extremely slow service at the expensive lounge, etc. On top of all this, their were big spiders and other bugs everywhere. I had spiders crawl on me at both the pool and the outdoor lounge, and took a photo of one on the window of our room. Overall, the hotel looks nice, but it is depressing and uncomfortable to stay there. We did have a good interaction with a bell-hop and conceirge, I think the staff problems are more with the management, as all the regular employees I encountered were friendly and nice, they just seemed overworked and overwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Offers a great view of the Chicago skyline, but requires a hike to get to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: cdkcurtis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are nice and what you would expect at a Hyatt. It offers a great location if you are visiting the museums.

Reviews.Title: “terrible location, hit and miss service.”
Reviews.Author: lcprieto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of no where, It's about a 10 minute car drive or a 15 minute bus ride to the milenium park. There is nothing around the hotel to walk to. The buss doesn't come very often, so you usually have to wait 15 to 20 minutes for it. The hotel doesn't provide a free business centre for it's custumers. The business centre charges 28 dollars an hour for internet!. The suiming pool is old, not preatty, and at least when we used it there was no one keeping it clean, there were used towels all over. The room was old, with old furniture, but very clean. You can hear your neghbours from your room, even if they're only talking. You can also hear people on the hallway. We did not try the restaurants. The service was preatty good at reception, but hit and miss with the concierges. Overall I would not stay here again. The hotel was not as good as other 4 star hotels, and the location was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: seethesightsUSA
Reviews.Content: We had a nice quiet stay here and the concierge staff was very helpful with info about how to get to various sites in the downtown area. The # 3 bus stop is very close and will take you north to downtown or south to Hyde park and the Museum of Science and Industry. There is a very good and very casual restaurant in walking distance called Pizzeria Brandi. Giordanos will deliver to the hotel which was nice cuz the wait for a table in one of the downtown locations was long. We got free internet because our room was not ready when we tried to check in at 5pm. Yes, 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: KLK62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for the July long weekend with our children (2 teens, 2 adults with spouses). The Hyatt is not in the thick of the Chicago downtown area, but it is within close range of major attractions. We immediately purchased a 3 day Metro pass which eliminated any further driving and parking woes. Easy access to downtown and Wrigley Field. After talking to the concierge, we were able to obtain parking in an outdoor lot, a 5 min. walk from the hotel for $30 for the weekend - rather than the $30/per night at the hotel. It doesn't look like there is much around (McDonald's - 5 minute walk), but there are some nice restaurants about a 10- 15 minute walk on Michigan Ave. Large fitness centre with lots of weight machines and cardio machines. Pool has two marked lanes. Also featured a variety store in the lobby with Starbucks. One night we had very noisy neighbours and were told by the front desk to contact security if it happened again but it was not repeated. The hotel was very clean, modern and staff were friendly and helpful. We would definetely stay here again. Obtained the room through a Priceline bid of $85. While in Chicago highlights were the Architecturial Boat Tour, Wrigley Field, drinks on the 96th floor of the Hancock Building.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency - Great Hotel Experiences”
Reviews.Author: CHF_ILARNG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place for a weekend marriage retreat. We've also stayed at the Hyatt Regency down on the loop as well. The Hyatt McCormick Place isn't as upscale as the Hyatt on the loop, but the room quality was equivalent. The views from the north side of the 15th floor were excellent. Room service was quite expensive, but delicious none the less. It's a good location if you want close access to Lake Shore Dr., Interstate 55, or the Chicago Skyway. The other Hyatt is the way to go if you prefer fine dining, theatre, and shopping because most of those locations are within walking distance. We did like the conference centers as well the hotel catering for our events in the conference centers. The staff was great. Overall experience a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced, to far out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Harry7777
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago attending a conference at McCormick Place. Our corporate travel folks put me here much to my chagrin. An OK hotel, but unless you are just going to McCormick Place it is too far out of the way and they really take advantage of you - $5 cup of coffee, $13 bar drinks, $50/day parking!! and expensive rooms to boot. I took the EL in to town, a 10 minute walk, but through a nasty looking neighboorhood. And getting in an out of downtown by taxi is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: thincinc
Reviews.Content: My wife, and I stayed here over the Memorial Day Weekend. Very nice place. Very nice room. Andrea, at the front desk was professional, and personable. We asked her to recommend a restaurant. Not only did she, but she printed out the menu for us, and gave us the name, and address as well. We called down, and asked for the towels to be changed that day. There was a knock on the door within minutes, our towels had arrived. This is a convention center, so it being a little south of the museums, etc., is understandable. Andrea suggested we buy a CTA one day fun pass which allows unlimited train, and bus service for the 24 hour period after you first us it. There is a bus stop out front. Andrea was great, as well as the other staff we encountered. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DivaJetSetter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband and I for our anniversary weekend in chicago. We didn't mind the distance for downtown because we had a car and it wasn't far by car. We also parked on the street per advice from another trip advisor. The room was decent i thought when we 1st got there but I couldn't figure out why our allergies were a little crazy. the 2nd morning we had the privacy sign up until we left at about 10 am. we got back at around 8:30ish in the evening and not only was the room not cleaned but it now smelled of cigarette smoke and the remote had been moved. When I was looking around the room I started seeing areas with dust caked up which explained the allergies. My husband called and said there's no point in cleaning now because we're going to bed but we want a new room. When he told them about the remote and the cig. smell in a nonsmoking room he was told the housekeeping staff are allowed breaks... so they can smoke in a nonsmoking room and chill in a paid for room... OK. They said they were booked solid that night but we'd be moved the next day. They did give us a room with a king bed instead of the 2 doubles that we originally had, a floor with much better views of the city, and a food and beverage credit. We were pleased with the attempt to improve the stay. We just were very disappointed overall with them. We've both stayed at some very nice hotels and thought we were treating ourselves to a Hyatt. unfortunately the hotel we stayed at on our honeymoon was much better. I wish I would've just booked with them.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for Chicago Bears Draft Party and Expo”
Reviews.Author: natedogg4116
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. We were in the hotel for a very short time as we only stayed one night, but the staff was very helpful. The concierege answered our questions about distance to Soldier Field, where the free shuttle was and where we could find a late-night menu. I booked the hotel room a little late so while I would have liked a view of the Chicago skyline, we enjoyed watching the fireworks from US Cellular field. The man who ran up our late-night pizza was very nice and asked us twice if there was anything else that he could do or get for us. The rooms were big and I especially liked the room divider that makes the room feel even bigger. The next time we are in Chicago, I will not think twice about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: yatasamochka
Reviews.Content: On the website it said that the hotel is within walking distance from most of the major attraction. That was pretty far from the truth. The only thing it was withing walking distance was the mccormick center and a bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: winterlight37
Reviews.Content: We combined my wife's stay for a convention with a weekend with the kids (4 and 9). The kids loved the place, especially the pool and the nearby escalators in the McCormick Center. The staff was professional, which I expected, but remarkably friendly, too. I saw some crabby guests, but the employees at the Hyatt smiled right through it all (happy employees = good management). We enjoyed exceptional service from start to finish: doorman, bellman, front desk, maintenance (delivered refrigerator), pool attendant, housekeeper, concierge, room service, bartender, bar hostess/manager, and finally, the parking garage attendant and manager (key didn't work on final exit but it was taken care of quickly). No kidding: smiles across the board. If you self park, be sure to pay at the desk. That way you can get in and out without paying $27 each time rather than $27/day. You can get to your car easily and quickly, and the location means you'll probably be using your car. On the other hand, it's the closest hotel to the convention center, and the food service in the hotel is is a good value. The hotel has a nice view of the lake to the south, but looking north toward the skyline is better. The windows needed cleaning, but everything inside was immaculate. Finally, for family travelers, consider bringing your bicycles during summer. The trails to the museums and Navy Pier are close, and there's a beautiful stretch of shoreline running south that was well-policed and bounded by the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mrali52
Reviews.Content: well, what to say about Hyatt. The name itself has it. Chicago was our last destination in USA before returning to MUMBAI. So we thought to stay in the Best hotel. And there it was. it was excellent hotel. we had a pleasant stay and took advantage of the various services given by Hyatt. Its anytime a recommendation, but only if u have a good budget with you. Its very heavy on pocket ;)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - not a very good location”
Reviews.Author: leahrj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and it was a pleasant experience. I got a great deal from priceline, so I can't really complain! The hotel's lobby is absolutely gorgeous and I ordered room service and ate at Shor Restaurant; both were great. I had a nice view of the Chicago skyline that I enjoyed until the weather fogged it all up! :) My only real complaint (besides no free wifi!) is the location; there is nothing really nearby, so if you're going to explore downtown Chicago within walking distance, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “My GO-TO Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrw715
Reviews.Content: The reason i love this place... Great hotel, great location, great staff and reasonable rates. Its my GO-TO hotel everytime I'm in chicago. No the location isnt on the magnificent mile, but its a very very short cab ride away, its convenient for grant park, south loop and great for getting around to all parts of the city and suburbs. Now admittedly if you are not here for a conference and there is a big conference going on its pretty busy. My most recent visit however was a very low key weekend and the staff and hotel was everything I could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerleading Competition at McCormick Center!"”
Reviews.Author: Dan D
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy with the electronic check in. When we got to our room late at night with two young girls we were disappointed to find we were given a smoking room even though we booked two months out and request non smoking. After a little trouble trying to contact a manager for help we were finally able to. The staff and management corrected the problem quickly, efficiently and in a way to satisfy us. Thanks for the wonderful handling of a bad situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if...”
Reviews.Author: perryspires
Reviews.Content: It is a great place if your only going to be at the convention center. It is a bit far from downtown. Not a p.leasant walk

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicholasdamian
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in Chicago so we got the hotel for ourselves since the hotel was so quiet during Christmas time. Observation: 1. Rooms are tidy, could tell that hotel needs a bit renovation. 2. Staff were very nice and helpful. One hiccup was when I asked for cleaning service but took forever but as long as they were done, then it's OK overall. 3. Location is close to Chinatown and downtown if you have a car. Overall, it's OK, I would come back just for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was what I'd expect from a Hyatt- in EASTERN EUROPE!”
Reviews.Author: Galactus23
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this hotel, a family member did as a bunch of us flew in for a wedding. If I had to spend more than 36 hours there I would have left for somewhere else. This hotel, which I actually saw on some websites had 5 stars, was a dump. It was more like staying in a college dorm than a hotel. The room smelled. The carpet was gross and old. There was no real closet. The worst part was they didn't have a fitted bedsheet for the mattress- they put a top sheet on for the bottom sheet, which of course slid off anytime you moved. The room was just disgusting. When we checked in Friday night, about 830, we were hungry, but the resaurant was closed (except for the bar). We did eat at the restaurant for breakfast, and it was actually good (great pancakes)- the only good part of the whole hotel. The hotel is only close to the convention center. EVERYTHING else is a cab ride. They have a one-way shuttle downtown, but only leaves every hour. When I inquired about it, the concierge didn't know the times it left and didn't tell me that I could make a reservation for it (fortunately my family member found out and reserved us seats or that would have been another cab fare). Overall, for this same money I've stayed in Marriott Courtyards and Hampton Inns 10x as nice. This place was just horrible.

Reviews.Title: “I got stuck in a small corner room”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: Just not a great location for Chicago. I moved hotels after two nights to a Marriott that was very central off of Michigan Ave for the same price. The room I got stuck in was pathetic for a Grand Hyatt Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: boomboomroom
Reviews.Content: As many before me have mentioned, this is a great hotel for the convention center - you don't even have to go outside. If the reason for your trip is a convention, then I think it's the best possible choice. I attended a conference in Chicago and stayed at this hotel as well as the Hyatt Regency on Wacker (the Hyatt Regency Chicago). I think of the two the McCormick Place Hyatt is more modern and has probably been more recently updated. The room was very clean, the room design was more current, and the bathroom fixtures were newer. On the other hand, I think the service at this hotel was perhaps not as serene as at the Hyatt on Wacker - I had longer waits to speak with the concierge/front desk at the McCormick Place Hyatt, and I got some "I don't knows" from the front desk in response to questions they should have been able to accommodate. One example was when we inquired regarding the Metra, which is the closest public transportation option to our hotel - they didn't have any schedules on hand and could not tell us anything about using it. Another example - I left an item in my room when I checked out, and one of my colleagues who was still in the room brought it down to be mailed to me and filled out a FedEx slip with my name and address. Due to a lack of communication between the front desk and the packing departments, however, calls to the front desk about my item the next day got a response that they didn't know anything about it. After calling back again, and speaking to shipping, where it turns out my item would have languished until I managed to get connected to someone who knew something about it, they finally took my credit card information and sent my item, which I have since received. I am inclined to attribute some of this confusion to the fact that many people were checking out the day I did, and I had confidence that this issue would eventually be resolved satisfactorily, but I think the front desk could strive to emulate the focus on service that the Hyatt on Wacker demonstrated to me during my stay there.That said, for attending a conference in Chicago I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre...not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: michael30309
Reviews.Content: The good: Housekeeping was superb. The clothes I accidently left on the bed were folded and placed on the desk. The hotel connects to the convention center. If you're attending a conference, it's nice to get to the conference in under 5 minutes. The lobby is pretty modern/nice and full of extensive groups of comfortable couches--perfect for doing work or meeting with others. The bad: the walls are SUPER THIN--my neighbor's 2am shower sounded as if it were from my room. You can hear everything from the hallway--from people closing doors to full conversations. Good thing I'm a sound sleeper! The cable wasn't working for half of my trip (likely due to rain-satellite TV I assume). The fitness center (which isn't as extensive as Hyatt boasts) was completely packed each morning between 7-9am. I couldn't get on any of the bikes, elipticals or treadmills. Finally, the rooms were just okay. Nothing spectacular (great views from the top floors facing north). The ugly: NOTHING IS INCLUDED and the ammenities are massively expensive. Internet (which has cut out on me 3x since starting this review) is 10 dollars per day; if you want high speed cable internet, it will cost you 15 dollars per day. Drinks at the bar were 11-14 dollars for well drinks, water/soda is 2.50+ tax, and use of a computer or printer at the business center is about 10 dollars. Because nothing is around the hotel (and the surroundings are a bit sketchy), you're really stuck on paying for highly overpriced room service or ordering delivery. When you factor in a high price per night, you can easily expect to pay 300 dollars per night to stay here. In all, I would recommend this hotel for those who don't care about price and want to stay literally in the convention center. Keep in mind that a taxi here from downtown is 12-15 dollars each way and there is also METRA service and tons of bus service to the convention center. So, if you don't mind 10-20 min travel time, staying at a nicer and cheaper hotel downtown may be your best bet for the money. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel itself looks great, but location and shuttle are horrible”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesVivian
Reviews.Content: the hotel and room are clean and new and moden. no question about that. BUT it's so far! you end up paying all the money you save on taxis, buses, and trains anyway. the free shuttle they provide only drops you off in 3 locations. you have to find your own way back. and they dont start running until 11am! who starts their day at 11am!? i ended up paying for taxi rides to downtown and back which ended up being about $20 per trip each way

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: melissa1233
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through priceline and got a great deal on our room. Upon entry, the hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. Our surprise came when we saw our room. We were on the 15th floor and had a beautiful view of the Chicago skyline!!! The room was very clean- the toiletries were a nice touch (toothpaste, soaps. etc). The only main problem we ran into was parking. I had called prior to our visit and the woman told me that we could do self park with in and out priveledges for $27. When we tried to leave to go into town for dinner, we were charged to leave. We spoke with the front desk and they told us that we were misinformed and that we could try and ask the valet if we could switch to that.. We waited outside for 10 minutes and no one was out there, so we left and paid. The drive to downtown was short and convenient. Another problem was that there were no vending machines for late night drinks! We ended up ordering a pizza with soda around 1 am from a local pizza place. The hotel was very clean and upscale. We loved it! My boyfriend proposed to me here, so I love it!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Bear game!”
Reviews.Author: Delos123
Reviews.Content: Good location to Bear game/ shed aquarium/ museum. No in/out parking sucks. Overpriced for the room quality.

Reviews.Title: “All's well that ends well”
Reviews.Author: Eismine
Reviews.Content: I took my family with me on a business/leisure trip. We arrived at the hotel after 7 pm to find they did not have any standard rooms. Apparently one of their guest decided to stay another day. The hotel offered to take us to another location or give us the living room section of a suite. We took the suite because we were tired and my convention started the next morning. Although the room was large w/a wet bar, the rollaway beds they provided did not offer a restful sleep for anyone in our party. I complained to the front desk the next day and they immediately moved us to another room, gave us 3 breakfast vouchers, a bowl of fruit and complimentary water. We also received a letter of apology from the hotel Manager and a phone number to call if we needed to. The room was wonderful! We had a lovely view of the lake and downtown. Although the hotel is far from downtown, they have a free shuttle that will take you to tourist sites. Kudos to the staff who made the rest of our stay enjoyable. This review is a little late in coming but i wanted to make sure they were thanked

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: noodles77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a night stay at Hyatt! It was far beyond my expectation! Staff were very willing to please! Ate lunch at M/X food was very good! Ate Breakfast at Shor was Good! Room had awesome view of city and was very clean! Slept in alot of Hotels and this bed was by far the best! Has shuttle that will take you to navy pier and Musuems! But no return shuttle so be prepared to take cab back or bus! Would recommend and return to this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great benefits and View”
Reviews.Author: lovintraveling
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty! It was easy to access the hotel from the highway and the parking garage was easily accessed for self parking. Check in went smoothly, we had reserved as part of a Summer Package and received a room w/ a city/lake view on the top floor! Also as part of the package was free self park and free wireless internet. The concierge was very helpful and recommended a place for dinner. We did see a show, "The Color Purple" at the Arie Crown Center in McCormick Place and getting to and from the show was extremely easy and completely indoors. The hotel does offer a free shuttle to the Mag. Mile but it only leaves on the hour and only has 14 seats so it was booked for any time that we wanted to go. Taxi to the Mile depending on where you are going is $10-15 each way. The room was a fair size and clean. The decor was slightly older but in good shape. Our view from 3313 was AMAZING! We could see Navy Pier, the marina and several of downtowns buildings. The beds at the Hyatt hotels are wonderful and we never have a hard time sleeping:) I did use the Fitness Center and it was very nice and accessible 24 hours. The only downside of this hotel for me is that it is a little out of the way for what I am usually doing in Chicago. I would definetely stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable at a great price”
Reviews.Author: UtahtoNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and they frequently have great price discounts available through Priceline. The staff is very courteous and they go out of their way to help you enjoy your stay. The hotel is very clean from the lobby/check-in to the rooms. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quite large for a standard hotel room. There were also great amenities like Aquafresh toothpaste and great shampoo/conditioner. I would have to say that this hotel is a bit out of the way. It's close to the convention center which is near Soldier Field. It's about a $10 cab ride into the city and believe me that cab ride is worth it for the deal you get here. The hotel also has an hourly shuttle to take you into the city. I would suggest to the hotel that this become a half hour shuttle as it can fill up quickly and also, it's easier to plan your day if you can leave on a more flexible schedule. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Only good if you have bussiness at McCormick Place, stay elsewhere otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: MySreenName22
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. If you are attending an event or exhibiting at McCormick Place its a good place to stay, because you don't have to deal with parking each day and can simply walk from the hotel to the convention center without even going outside. However, as a hotel for seeing chicago, its to far from downtown, which means you will have to take expensive cabs just to get to the typical tourist attractions. Also, there is an incredible lack of dinning options after midnight (not even a vending machine and nothing within walking distance of the hotel), so if you are coming in late to the hotel, be sure to eat before you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, but the location was not to my liking”
Reviews.Author: BWLPack
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent hotel, but I prefer to be a little more north. Most of the better destinations in Chicago are a few miles north of this McCormick Place location. This hotel has an excellent location to Soldier Field, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, and the Field Museum .. so that was a positive. They offer shuttle service to various spots, so the location might not be much of a problem for everybody. All told though it was a great bargain for me as I was able to secure a room for $77 per night thru Priceline, but in the future I will look to stay a little north of this location. I had a nice stay though, and I would recommend this hotel ... especially to those that plan on hitting the destinations I mentioned earlier, and for those that have business dealings in or around McCormick Place.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Name WITHOUT Hyatt 4-Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: Naka2nv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the Rock-N-Roll Chicago Half Marathon and although it was a somewhat nice enough hotel, its definitely NOT hyatt 4-Star Quality. This hotel deserves a 3Star at best (3.5 is pushing it). There was sitting water in our bathtub, the room was warm upon check in, the pillows on the bed were stained and the renovations mentioned on their site werent apparent (the wall paper in our bath room was peeling off the wall). The bathrooms are EXTREMELY small. We requested another room and were told there were none available and after calling several times and going back to the front desk, another room was provided for us which makes me feel like we were lied to because just 10mins before that there was "nothing available". I wouldnt suggest this hotel to anyone. Also it is far from all of the "Michigan Ave" attractions, you'll need a cab or bus to get ANYWHERE except the convention center which is attached to the hotel. Its an optimal hotel for business travel but i wouldnt chose to stay here again otherwise. If youre a hyatt fan, i'd opt for Hyatt Regency Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Checking in and parking are ridiculous, but rooms are nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sugharpy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Chicago with our three kids. We tried to secure our rooms an hour before check in...at most hotels you can check in, secure your rooms, but then simply wait until official check in to get your keys while the rooms are being prepared. At this hotel, this is impossible. During a very busy day, they made everyone wait around in the lobby until 3pm. It was packed with people. Why not just check everyone in, and then have them wait to get the key only? Then those who got there early have a better chance of getting the room type requested? As it was for us, we had kids with us and waiting in a packed space is trouble, so we left to go to the aquarium. By the time we came back we were on SEPARATE FLOORS. We were told the next day they would automatically move us to new, connected rooms. Nope. We had to come up and request it again, making us wait to find new rooms, and then wait for our luggage. On top of that, people should know that parking is extremely high and if you want to use a car at all, that you are forced to use valet for in and out privileges for $38 a day or your parking is $27 each and every time you leave. Thankfully, the front desk people are kind (it's not their fault the check in system and parking is stupid), but it was a hassle. Contrary to a lot of reviews, the hotel's location isn't terrible at all, depending on why you are there. If you want nightlife and downtown, this is possible if you drive or take the bus, but if you are there for museums like we were, it's good. It's within walking distance of The Field Museum, Soldier Field, Shedd's Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, and 12th Street Beach, next to public transportation (the #3 bus pulls up right in front of the hotel), and has many places to eat nearby within walking distance or a short drive. Chinatown is a few blocks down Cermak Street. Checking out didn't work via television, so again we had to wait in line to check out. Also, although they have three kiosks available for checking in and out, none of them were ever working. Also, no free internet. No wi fi at all. Only a for-pay ethernet cable was available. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, and our view was beautiful. The hotel is perpendicular to the lake so if you are on any of three sides of the hotel, you get an awesome city AND lake view. I just wish it wasn't so much of a hassle to do simple things.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: highmaintenance100
Reviews.Content: As I read the previous reviews, I was a little concerned. I was going to be spending a week in this hotel for a conference. I was actually considering a different hotel. I contacted their customer service rep by e-mail and outlined my concerns. I needed a reliable internet connection. I needed a no-smoking room, on a no smoking floor (asthma), I needed a refrigerator in the room (medicine) I needed enough space in the room or at the bell stand for a scooter. I was assured by an e-mail response the next day that none of the above was a problem. I arrived early and was checked in immediately. The room was clean, spacious, and exactly what I needed. Some might quibble that it was not up-to-date but just give me a great bed, a desk with a task chair, a chair or couch for comfortable reading and be clean. A big plus was the state- of-the-art gym with plenty of treadmills and bicycles. (and towels) The housekeeping staff was generous with towels and de-caf coffee for the in room machine. The place was packed with my compatriots and really it is perfect if you are going to be at the Convention Center, just an elevator ride and an enclosed walkway away. The service was consistent. The staff really got that those people were anxious to get to their meetings but also needed breakfast. The wait staff was friendly; the food in the hotel restaurant was fresh and fast. The coffee came in a press and the tea was a premium brand with a pot. So here we are the last night. Dropped stuff off at the package room. The person manning the room was efficient and keen on detail. And yes, the public bus for $2.25 picks up right in front of the hotel for a trip to the museum or downtown. If you are an experienced business traveller, I pretty sure that you will be content with this choice as my friend who checked out this morning said, this is a hotel that really gets what we need. And yes, a clean fast internet connection as I send this recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ldorcik
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it is a Hyatt. We were on the 10th floor (1002) on 4th of July and could see about 6 to 8 different fireworks shows put on by the smaller communities of Chicago. I liked that the hotel was away from the crowds. It costed about $15 to get to the Navy Pier by taxi. They also offer a shuttle service on the hour. You have to sign up for it ahead of time. It gets full quick, so as soon as you check in you may want to get your name on the sheet. The room was beautiful and the bathroom was huge. I am very happy with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Mikeymike15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 1 night in June on a Saturday when I went to watch the USvHonduras World Cup Qualifier. PRICE: $85 plus tax on Priceline.com was well worth it. (there was three of us staying at the hotel so it helped even more). ROOM: Room was crisp and clean. Neatly cut blue and white linens on the bed, large flat screen TV. Pseudo bathroom where the sink was out side of the bathroom itself (sort of like a large water closet where the toilet and shower was behind the door). Room wasn't huge but it came with a double bed. We didn't stay in the room very long, just a place to clean up, store our stuff, and sleep for a couple of hours before an early morning flight. LOCATION: About a 10 minute walk from soldier field, couldn't ask for a better location to support events at the stadium. Easy access to downtown Chi-Town. AMENITIES: Didn't see much in the way of newspapers or extras. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment much on that. The one problem I had was I couldn't connect to the high-speed internet or it wasn't available. SERVICE: Staff was pleasant and efficient. Checked-in and out with ease. Overall, from my limited stay, I would recommend this hotel. It definitely felt like a business hotel as it was attached to a convention center but for one night from Priceline, it's top notch in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Stay closer to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Chelledan03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to go to Cubs game and then hang out in downtown area afterwards. There were 6 of us and no minivan taxis so we all crammed into one taxi. Was so far from downtown area we didn't go back there to change clothes because it would have cost to ride a taxi back and forth. If you are planning on being downtown for your outings my advice would be to find something downtown instead. We paid around $90 for our room. I'm guessing you could find something for same price but with more convenience. Took a limo back to hotel and the driver couldn't even find our hotel. It is a very nice hotel but just too far from everything. Self parking is $27 and valet is around $38.

Reviews.Title: “When In Chicago Stay at the Hyatt at McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: Ken_N_SF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt McCormick Place and was very impressed. The suite was beautiful, the views we outstanding. We were able to view a fireworks display at the Navy pier form our room on Saturday night - I wondered if Liz, the Guest Experience Manager, ordered that display for our party. Service was excellent, the suite was excellent and very roomy. The view of downtown Chicago and the lake were awesome. The staff was great and helped us out by providing extra trash cans in the room. We had a get together at my suite after the graduation, 30 people and tons of food fit easily. The staff helped us transport the supplies and food in and out of the hotel. It was an excellent location as I was attending an event at UoC. Access to downtown was very easy. I would very much like to stay here again. As a matter of fact, it was very hard to leave the room to head back home. LCD tv, great walk-in closet, nice living room area and very highly recommended! I want to thank Liz and the staff for making my stay a memorable and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Had fabulous time!!”
Reviews.Author: plutoillinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt McCormick Place and loved it!! Service was excellent, rooms very nice, the pool was warm and wonderful. Great finess center!! Very convenient to soldier field!! Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “they care”
Reviews.Author: CHUCKLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Let's just say the front desk cares what you think about the place. So...upper management is doing its job. They take care of you when they mess up. Part of me wishes that they didn't mess up. The hotel plays the part however, it is 50 ft from the main lobby of the convention center. Beats the hell out of waiting for a shuttle. other stuff: walls are waaaay too thin, business center is clean but a rip off

Reviews.Title: “Almost Clean but great location”
Reviews.Author: flyingpresenter
Reviews.Content: If the first room I checked into was clean I would have been happier--the location couldn't be better for access to McCormick Place. The business center was useful, but I preferred the Kinko's in McCormick Place. I didn't take advantage of the Restaurants in the hotel--much prefer to check out some new places in Chicago. Parking seemed a bit expensive and honestly, why can't the staff read? If the sign says entrance and exit to the parking structure... why would they block it off and allow people to almost get into accidents. The room is modern but they should join the ranks of hotels providing free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntlSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during a tradeshow in March. Booked a standard king room and was upgraded to a Corner Suite (I am a Diamond member with Hyatt). Check-in was fast and efficient. The staff was friendly and very professional. For those attending a trade show at McCormick Place, you cannot beat the convenience of a 5 minute walk from your hotel room to the exhibition area. The rooms are very clean and up-to-date as far as modern furnishings go. (LCD tv, nice furniture, decorations). The bed is very soft and comfortable - perfect for resting after standing all day during a trade show. The bathroom is somewhat small, but great nonetheless. Noise was not an issue, although you could hear the occasional sound of doors closing in the hallway. The hotel is located right next to McCormick Place, which is situated south of the Chicago downtown area. If you're visiting as a tourist and have no business at McCormick, I recommend staying elsewhere. Otherwise, you will be spending money on taxi fare or spending 15-20 minutes walking to the downtown/Magnificent Mile area. I tried the breakfast buffet at the restaurant downstairs and it had a wide selection of good food with great service. The bar/lounge was ok but service was poor, most likely due to the large crowd of tradeshow visitors. I would stay here again only if I had to visit McCormick Place.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at if you have business at McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: yahplayer
Reviews.Content: Just returned having attended a conference at McCormick Place. The hotel itself is clean and 4 star quality.
